Reviews.Title: “Very Happy with this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Showyoucare
Reviews.Content: First Time staying here for just one night. Everything is great, quiet, bed are great, sheets are awesome. Clean, Big TV's, Convenient to everything. The best part is the great complimentary breakfast, with just about anything you need or want. Hey and complimentary free bottles of water, who does that today?, Free internet. Priced well.

Reviews.Title: “Comfy Hotel with Friendly Staff & Hearty Breakfast”
Reviews.Author: OZMIK
Reviews.Content: Our family of 4 stayed 8 nights at this hotel before going to Whistler. This is a well run hotel & has provided for our family needs: good breakfast, close to food outlets, restaurants, public transport-Stadium/Chinatown Station, easy walk to Robson St Shopping area as well as near a Costco. Good housekeeping & a shuttle is available to go anywhere in downtown. Our kids loves playing table tennis when my wife & I could relax in the whirlpool. Tea & coffee are available all day. Staff are always helpful & friendly. Thank you so much Susan at the reception for providing us a room on the higher floor & for organising our family first ski lessons at Grouse Mountain. We had so much fun at Grouse (they open till 10pm!!!) that we spent 3 full days skiing there. My wife had a cut on her hand & Chris at the reception gave her band-aid & disinfectant spray. We had to leave at 5am & the hotel staff gave us takeaway breakfast. All these things are the reason why I gave this hotel an excellent rating even though it is not a 5 Star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Cannot Beat This Value!”
Reviews.Author: honeymooners34
Reviews.Content: This hotel was wonderful!!! The complimentary shuttle and bikes with the breakfast each morning really made it super great deal for us. One night after a long day’s work/adventure, we just went to the Jacuzzi and soaked our feet. The sauna was great as well!! Our room was quiet and clean with a view of the neon-lit BC Stadium. Breakfast included eggs and sausage daily with scones, oatmeals, cereals, fruit, juices – everything we needed. The waffles we made each day were our very favorite. About two blocks up the street from the hotel, 489 Robson, there was a grocery store, MarketPlace, which enabled us to stock our room refrigerator. The bicycle rental enabled trips through Stanley Park, to Granville Island, Chinatown, and Gastown. The staff was very friendly and provided great solutions to any challenge we had for them. The location was good as well. Though we were traveling to the convention center each day, the shuttle made it very convenient and we could either walk back to the hotel (which was a pleasant, 20 minute walk or so) or take the train (4 minute journey). Upon our arrival was the most pleasant orange and strawberry water. We purchased the 10 ticket books for the train from the airport (7 eleven domestic terminal), so it made taking the train very easy. The shuttle and bikes must be reserved each day. The hotel was also very safe. Hotel room keys operated the elevators and the surrounding areas outside of the hotel seemed clean and safe, no matter how late. We arrived to the hotel at dark and left in the early morning hours. They also provided bottled a water. Another bonus. It was truly a delight staying at this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and Comfy”
Reviews.Author: BeckyReardon
Reviews.Content: My husband, friend and I spent the last 6 days at the Hampton in downtown Vancouver. The location on Robson was great.....adjacent to the stadium where the Canucks play. It was very convenient for getting around the town and shopping. The hotel is very comfortable and clean. Our only problem with them was a television that wouldn't work, and wasn't replaced until the second night of our stay. The staff at the desk were not particularly helpful or friendly. The breakfast bar was great though, and the folks working there were very nice. Good stay overall.

Reviews.Title: “Never expected this from a Hampton Inn!”
Reviews.Author: davidmeyer
Reviews.Content: Because I spend most of my week on the road, I usually try as much as possible to stay away from the "Value" brands of chains. So when the Hampton Vancouver was recommended to me I almost declined...but I am glad I did not. First of all, the rooms rivaled anything that a full-service hotel would offer, and we're, in fact, bigger than most of them. They were nicely appointed and the best part...you could actually control the temperature in your room (the thermostat actually worked). The free breakfast was decent, as was the location to everywheree you may wish to get to in Vancouver. The ONLY drawback was the parking. If you have a large car, you'll have a heck of a time in the garage...and in most garages in Vancouver you'll find the same thing.

Reviews.Title: “fun and family friendly”
Reviews.Author: onesar
Reviews.Content: great location, only a 20 minute cab ride from airport right into downtown area. we loved that not only is it what we expected of the hotel chain but even better as there was a ping pong table as well as foosball up on the 16th floor! we walked to nearby Yaletown and checked out most of the downtown area and then headed up for some family fun! nice walk to False Creek where we took a boat to Granville Island. Near BC Place, for those Hockey fans. Complimentary waters and local calls, as well as chocolates at check in! Only complaint was one morning there was a huge rush at breakfast and they ran out fast... it was replenished but took a little time to do that.

Reviews.Title: “Good quality on edge of Yaletown and Gastown”
Reviews.Author: CanTravel106
Reviews.Content: Loacated across from BC Place, easy to get o/ from. Good quality hotel - newer, nice rooms, helpful staff. Good self- serve breakfast included.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient to BC Stadium & Chinatown”
Reviews.Author: RussBock
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay on the 15th floor, overlooking BC Stadium and Robson Street. Easy walk to Chinatown, Robson Street shopping, Rogers Arena and just across the street from the BC Stadium. We had a king suite, which was roomy, quite and had a small kitchen. Bed and pillows were comfortable. The included breakfast buffet was the typical Hampton Inn offering, OK but not great. Parking is about $26/d.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice property”
Reviews.Author: Patches07
Reviews.Content: We've stayed here a few times when going to a Canucks game. It is perfect! Friendly staff at check-in. Very nice (free) breakfast with waffles, eggs, sausage, pastries, cereals, fruit, etc. Bedrooms are very clean, beds are very comfortable and the rooms are a nice size - quite roomy. Quiet, too. There is not much in the area EXCEPT Rogers Arena and BC Place, though. You have to walk a bit for good dining. But I would stay here in a heartbeat if attending an event at those two arenas.

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home”
Reviews.Author: Traveller653
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is located in a great location. The city is easy to drive around and the hotel is centrally located, with a secure parking garage. The hotel staff was knowledgable and friendly. The suites are a generous size and comfortably furnished. The beds and are comfortable and the linens fresh. Free wi-fi in the rooms and free breakfast. The breakfast buffet offered a variety of choices to include delicious scrambled eggs. The woman who staffed the breakfast buffet was pleasant and welcoming. The hotel provided little extra's like the paper and bottled water. The fireplace in the lobby was a nice place to sit while waiting to meet friends. I recommend this hotel and will return here the next time I am in Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place Near BC Place - Go Figure...”
Reviews.Author: TravelGuy045
Reviews.Content: Very nice clean hotel - hey its a Hampton Inn they do that!. The bed was great - I did eat in the resturant attached not sure if they own it but it was excellent. The free breakfast was a delite and the lady making all the magic happen was friendly and a delite to deal with. The garge was the most secure I have ever felt with not one but two steel doors - not sure why they would need all that secuirty - a bit concerning. Some great resturants near by within walking distance. Think I paid $110.00 per night which for downtown Vancouver is almost cheaper than owning your own condo :) I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best Hampton Inn's our there”
Reviews.Author: wildthing271
Reviews.Content: After my first night at the Vancouver Airport Hilton, I moved downtown. As I had to self fund the weekend in between business stays, I stayed at the Hampton Inn, partly because it was cheap, partly because I wanted the Hilton points, and partly because it was convenient for the NHL at Rogers Arena. Despite an early arrival, I was able to check in straight away, and I was given a suite. It was, quite honestly, the best room I have ever had in a Hampton Inn. It was larger than my apartment, with a sizeable kitchen, a large living room, and a large bedroom. The bathroom was standard size. It was spotless - I could not find anything to complain about at all in terms of cleanliness. The towels were large and soft, and the amenities, whilst being the standard Hampton amenities, were plentiful. The kitchen area was equipped with a dual hob, dishwasher, fridge, microwave, and various electricals. There was also a coffee maker, as expected in any room, with a plentiful supply of sugar and coffee. The living room and bed room both had large flat screen televisions. The view was nothing to write home about, being as it was of the construction site next door, but this did not affect me at all. WiFi was free and I was able to connect multiple devices - iPad, iPhone and work laptop with no issue. Location was good - a little further from the airprot Skytrain than I expected, but still only 5 or 6 blocks. I had tickets for the Canucks hockey, and Roger's arena is only about 3 blocks away...very convenient. I could mark the hotel down on the breakfast - but with Hampton's in North America, you know what it is going to be - it was not exotic, but certainly adequate. The biggest downsize to the breakfast was the horde of screaming toddlers on morning 1, who seems to regard the buffet island as an obstacle to run around, and the fact that on morning 2, I seemed to be the only person at breakfast NOT wearning pyjamas (I was in normal day clothes I hasten to add!). An excellent property in a great location.

Reviews.Title: “GOOD LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: linlu65
Reviews.Content: We stayed here fro 2 nights with 2 children in a room with 2 queen beds. It was very clean with coffee machine and plenty of room for the 4 of us. Breakfast was also very good especially the make your own waffles. The staff were very helpful with directions and organising transport to the airport for us. The hotel is close to the waterfront and Yaletown with lots of restaurants and shops. Wish we could spend more time in the lovely city of Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Hampton Inn”
Reviews.Author: Jaz187
Reviews.Content: This was an excellent value Hotel. We stayed here in July 2011 and it was a convenient location just next to Yaletown. It is walking distance to Gastown and Stanley Park, which we really enjoyed. There were a few drug addicts wandering around this part of town, but we didn't feel unsafe. The free breakfast was quite good too. I would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service and HUGE rooms”
Reviews.Author: Fern T
Reviews.Content: Staying two nights here in vancouver and have two children (5 and 7). The suite we are in is HUGE with kitchen and a great games and fitness centre. There is a coin operated laundry which is super clean and cheap $1.50 per wash. Location is great a close to the sky rail( 2 blocks) and we had its of bags to carry so it really was a easy walk. Highly recommend this accomm.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hampton yet”
Reviews.Author: Hammy59
Reviews.Content: I booked two rooms and travelled with friends from Seattle for a one night break in Vancouver. The weather wasn`t kind but the hotel more than made up for it and I was really delighted with our choice. I have stayed in countless Hamptons throughout the USA and this was easily the finest. On arrival we were upgraded to a king suite and the room was huge, clean and very comfortable. Great location right near the main shopping street, great selection of food and indoor stadium. We used the the games room to play table tennis, fussball and the hot tub and the view from the open terrace was great. Breakfast was the usual fare but the staff were very cheery and when they heard that one of our young children had a birthday then they came back with a teddy bear for him. Its little points like that which make an impression......well done Vancouver Hampton !!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay most of the time...”
Reviews.Author: Thor_Odinsson
Reviews.Content: Arrived at the hotel, and was checked in fairly fast by Front Desk. I arrived to find an awkward, disturbing sight in the jetted tub. Four small pubic hairs remained from the last guests. I bought a frozen ice-cream pie from the Keg for a birthday and put it in the freezer. Unfortunately the hotel had a scheduled power outage from 11:30 AM until 4 PM on December 6th for maintenance, but this was not indicated on the website when booking the room for the hotel. If it was, I would have either selected a different hotel, or selected different dates to avoid the inconvenience. That meant TV and Internet and other non-essentials would not be available, and that made for a melted ice-cream birthday cake. The coffee makers are so small, and a larger one would be nice. The chocolates they give upon arrival are a nice touch but they used Lindt this time, and the ones they used before I actually like better, but I don't know the brand name. All in all, this place is usually a good hotel to stay in. It provides a free hot breakfast, but it could use an upgrade, and I wish it would stay open longer than 10 AM. It has free Internet and coin laundry costing $1.50 each for washer and dryer. I would say this hotel is a pretty good place to stay, but this last time was disappointing.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hampton Inn... possibly Best Vancouver Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: CDN-Traveller1961
Reviews.Content: I've stayed hear several times over the past 2 years and the service, cleanliness and downtown hotel value are excellent. The location is fantastic especially if you are going to a sporting event as well as using the hotel as a base for doing business in the greater Vancouver area (in addition to downtown). One tip; the underground parking is a bonus as long as you don't drive a very large vehicle like a Suburban or similar. Underground parking spaces are a little tight. So if your renting a vehicle during your trip, make sure it is mid-sized.

Reviews.Title: “Comfort and GR8 service”
Reviews.Author: Thornhillite
Reviews.Content: Stayed here several times during the past few years. Very clean and comfortable with excellent service at a good price. We stayed in a one bedroom suite which was very spacious with a full kitchen. Personnel were friendly and accommodating, especially the women in the breakfast room. Rooftop exercise room has a great view. Convenient to downtown and close to Cambie Bridge.

Reviews.Title: “Grey Cup 2012 week stay - Hampton Suites”
Reviews.Author: maratimer
Reviews.Content: We stayed here during the Grey Cup 2012 festivities and the hotel was clean, warm and friendly. The staff were happy to accommodate our requests for early check-in, late check-out and privacy when requested. Breakfast was on par for Hampton Suites, and a nice savings to our week. I was glad to hear from staff that the plastic cutlery used for breakfast was Eco-friendly and 100% bio-degradable when I inquired as to why they used them from a waste perspective. The elevators were a bit slow, but only due to the number of guests arriving so probably the same as other hotels during this busy time. Security was great, they ensured only guest access to the hotels with key cards, and front desk staff. Overall, I was pleasantly surprised with the hotel, the accommodations were very clean, beds were very comfy and bathroom supplies were never an issue. Having a fridge and microwave, amenities were great as well. We walked everywhere from Burrard, Granville, shopping, etc as well as very close to two sky trains so easy to get to from airport. Very happy with this hotel, would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Spotlessly clean, comfortable, good location”
Reviews.Author: Anna_Karen
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 weeks during house repairs, in a suite with king bed, with husband and toddler. I loved: Clean! They wash all bedding for every guest, vacuum the sofas, clean *under* furniture. Most hotels don't do that. Good-quality furnishings, all fairly new. Very comfy bed. Pretty good hot & cold breakfast buffet (though I got a little tired of it after the first week). Kitchen is good enough to make eggs & toast or pasta & sauce etc, but not a full meal (hot plates and a microwave, but no oven). Location pretty good: 5 min walk from Yaletown, 15 min walk from the heart of Robson street shopping district, 15 mins from Gasstown, all are good for shopping and restaurants. (Also some decent restaurants close by) Right by BC place. Generally very quiet - has double-pane windows and thick curtains, rooms seem very soundproof. Rooms are very bright too. To be aware of: they are not going for 'atmosphere' or 'character' here; it is in no way romantic! The staff is friendly rather than polished. Located at the boring end of Robson street (still a safe location in the city though). Right across from BC Place so if there is a concert you will hear it! Also not cheap: if you want romance and character, there are other hotels are in the same price range that would deliver better. Overall, my favorite hotel for a family stay.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel in downtown vancouver”
Reviews.Author: Nacii
Reviews.Content: stayed here couple of nights end of july, nice and clean. a bit crowded in the mornings, overall good value for vancouver

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - pity about the cutlery”
Reviews.Author: fluffybinks
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel based on reviews at TA and on location to Robson St and gaslight area. We spent 2 nights, to relax after business before our trip home. The location was great as we could walk everywhere, and even though there was a football game across the road in the stadium that we could see the roof of from our room, there was no noise in the room. The rooms are spacious and well appointed, a cheaper "Hilton-like" room i.e. the fittings are cheap but functional. But you get what you pay for. There is not much service - there is a bell man that is never at his post... you have to take luggage up to your room yourself. There is a complimentary breakfast - its not great but the coffee is drinkable and you can make your own waffles! You get what you pay for so all in all the hotel is great EXCEPT FOR ONE THING THAT WILL MAKE ME NEVER STAY AGAIN - WHY oh why do you have to eat breakfast from plastic knives and forks and plates! This is a horrible experience , not to mention the rubbish it creates - made me and my colleague vow to never stay here again. I overheard others talking about that too.

Reviews.Title: “Good value hotel in good location”
Reviews.Author: Travelling_Jag
Reviews.Content: Definitely recommend this hotel as good value for money. Good restaurant out front (Zachary) and location great ( especially for sports fans with stadium next door)

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hampton Inn”
Reviews.Author: HappyCamperNC
Reviews.Content: We stay at many Hampton Inns throughout the year and come to expect a clean and comfortable place to stay that is moderate in price. However, the Hampton Inn in downtown Vancouver rises above the average. From smooth and friendly check-in to a sparking clean upgraded suite, our stay exceeded our expectations. (Great Italian restaurant next door in a competing hotel.) Easy and free hotel shuttle to the cruise port.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location for BC Lions Game”
Reviews.Author: VE7CKT
Reviews.Content: We chose the Hampton Inn because of it's proximity to BC Place and the BC Lions game and it was an excellent choice. Very easy and prompt check-in. The room was a good size with comfortable queen beds. It was quiet and there was little noise from the street and none from other guests. Great complimentary breakfast. Would stay here again for other events at BC Place or Rogers Arena.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay before or after a cruise!”
Reviews.Author: SuzanneManhattan
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night prior to going on a cruise. Upon arrival, the front desk staff was an absolute delight and very helpful in getting accustomed with the downtown area. The room itself was a standard Hampton Inn room, and well kept. It is a highrise facility, so the view from the room was terrific. The location is optimal as it is in walking distance to lots of restaurants, shops, and last minute purchases (bottle of wine and pop/soda for the cruise). There is a downtown mall not too far away, and a free hotel shuttle helps transport you around...not to mention free shuttle to the cruise port! The only somewhat downside of this site is that the breakfast area has a small area for seating, but the offering of different types of foods is more significant than at other Hampton Inns. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location and brilliant value for money”
Reviews.Author: TeamThomasCapeTown
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Robson Street Hampton Inn recently following positive reveiws on trip advisor, and just wanted to add some additional information. Robson Street is the main shopping street and the hotel is located at the bottom of Robson Street. There are plenty of good places to eat in the area, and also walking distance to the skytrain station. There is parking in the building, and a bus stops right opposite the building. The room was huge with typical Hamton Inn fluffy white pillows and bedding. Spotlessly clean. We had a kitchenette in our room which was brilliant. Almost like a self catering, but with the convenience of a hotel. Breakfast was basic, but good. Free wireless internet access was fast. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, convenient, great ammenities”
Reviews.Author: Joshua G
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very conveniently located in downtown Vancouver. Staff is very welcoming and helpful. The rooms are equipped with anything you could possibly need for your stay. Having complimentary Wi-Fi is also a useful feature of the hotel. The rooms are very tidy and clean. It is definitely a good value for the rate paid. The restaurant downstairs has a nice atmosphere and the complimentary breakfast offered at the hotel is very varied and good. If you are looking for a great hotel with good value, this is your best bet for sure!

Reviews.Title: “great choice for a pre-cruise stay”
Reviews.Author: It's a Red Sox Nation
Reviews.Content: We arrived by train around 6pm and left the next morning around 10am but we have no complaints during our brief stay. We enjoyed dinner downstairs and even played some ping pong the next morning. It was nice to be in a metropolitan setting and we felt safe and comfortable. The complimentary transportation to the cruise terminal was a nice plus but be sure to reserve your time early in the morning.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, nice ammenties”
Reviews.Author: MarissaNH
Reviews.Content: We found that this place had clean, decent rooms which were very comfortable. It is very close to Yaletown and you can basically walk everywhere. We also found that you could have a ride at no charge to anywhere in Vancouver, you just have to find your way back. Andy was our driver both times and he was so friendly and helpful. I didn't even know they would do this so it was a very nice surprise! Breakfast is nice, pretty standard. Price was decent for a downtown hotel. The woman in the gift shop even personally changed my USD to CAD when our ATM wouldn't work, a very nice thing for her to do. Fitness center needs more machines.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: mktrip1
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel to stay in Vancouver. Their staff is very friendly. Breakfast is reasonably diversified. They got a fooseball/ping pong table on the 16th floor, which is where my kids spent most time. Parking is kind of expensif at 25+$ per night.

Reviews.Title: “Very central location with great food choices nearby”
Reviews.Author: GemmaSydney
Reviews.Content: We stayed for three nights and found the very central location to be extremely convenient for our first visit to Vancouver. Hotel is close to an extensive range of cafes/restaurants and shopping, supermarket etc; only a short walk to skytrain. Noise levels are not too bad – we were on 6th floor and it was pretty quiet through the night; but there is noise during the day from nearby construction on stadium. Room facilities are just as listed on website – good size bathroom; small fridge; microwave; coffee-maker; comfortable beds; it was great to have a table & 2 chairs in addition to a desk and computer chair; the complimentary internet access in room worked well. The air-conditioning was very touchy and did get too hot/cold at times beyond the set temperature – the sensors seem to take a long time to settle into the set temperature. Breakfast is included – not a huge range of choices but sufficient – 2 or 3 cereals; juice; fruit; yoghurt; waffles; toasts; egg. Have never before encountered the use of disposable paper plates and plastic cutlery in a hotel though. Hotel facilities included a gym and well set up coin operated laundry – we much appreciated the laundry facility. Zachary’s Restaurant had a small menu but nice meals and reasonably priced – thanks to the chef who was happy to meet special dietary needs. Very friendly and helpful wait staff – we had fun trying out the local brews on their advice.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Best view from Rooftop Jacuzzi at Night”
Reviews.Author: SheilaNewYorkCity
Reviews.Content: I arrived at the Hotel just as the first Hockey game of final playoffs was starting. After Rooftop Jacuzzi I paused to look down at crowds leaving BMO arena after the game with whoops of cheers going up all through the neighbourhood. This hotel was best location to see Vancouver come alive with opening win.The desk staff were helpful in finding a restaurant for dinner even drawing on a map the safe way to walk to Gastown and location of the lookout Tower a block away from restaurants on the waterfront. Don't believe talk about cold and rain as weather claimed before I flew in. While walking to and from the restaurant area it was sunny and warm with beautiful sunset over the waterfront with Mountains across the way in West Vancouver. Next day I was kind of cold after returning from Whistler and rooftop Jacuzzi after dark was magic overlooking the beautiful lights of Vancouver. Breakfast off lobby provided lots of foods to grab and take with you as I had to leave early both mornings for train tour. I really enjoyed the hotel and recommend it highly for downtown activities and nice long walk to Stanley Park and especially to catch a hockey game 2 blocks away. I fell in love with Vancouver and can't wait to return for longer visit and do that walk around Stanley Park which tourists assured me I could do form the Hampton Inn. I would definitely return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Standard hotel in good location”
Reviews.Author: wywk
Reviews.Content: I chose to stay at the Hampton Inn for 2 main reasons: I am part of the Hilton Honors program 2. Location + Price There is no wow about this hotel, room was pretty standard of average size, basic amenities. No mini-bar. You get a microwave, coffee/tea making facility and a small fridge which was convenient. Bathroom was small but clean with a tub/shower. Internet was free as part of the honors program which was a bonus. The bed was of queen size and comfy, room was quiet. I had view on the streets from my room which was nice. You also get daily free breakfast, nothing fancy but the usual (toasts, bagels, waffles, eggs, sausages, bacon, fresh fruits, yogurt, coffee, tea etc) and it was enough. The plus side was its location, it was a few mins away from the hop on/off tour bus stop, within walking distance to Chinatown and Gas town. There was also a chemist/pharmacy closely where you can get drinks and snacks. There were also a few restaurants around the area and a few coffee shops. All in all, I think it was a good place to stay in terms of value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Great Facility”
Reviews.Author: Niamb
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hampton Inn Vancouver for only one night, but it was a very pleasant stay. The staff were very helpful. The room was large and comfortable. We did not have breakfast, as we were having breakfast elsewhere but the area looked nice and the choices good. The entire facility was very clean. Best of all was on the 16th floor where there is a large, extensive, well-maintained fitness area, a hot tub, an outside seating area and a LAUNDRY. Now a laundry may not be a selling point to many but when you have been on vacation for a week and have an additional week in front of you its importance soars. There were two coin operated washers and dryers and a large folding table. It was in a good sized room with a window and access to the outside roof area. The equipment worked well and the dryers actually got the clothes dry on one run. There is also a vending machine for detergent and softener sheets. This hotel is conveniently located downtown. We chose it as it is both convenient to downtown, but also fairly close to the train station as we were heading out on the Rocky Mountaineer the next day. It is also fairly close to the bus station, which is also across the river. The Pacific Coast cross water bus from Victoria has a drop-off point downtown that is more convenient to the hotel, however. All in all it was a brief, pleasant and very productive stay as we left with bags full of clean, fresh clothing for the remainder of our vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Simply Amazing!!!”
Reviews.Author: eeyore10479
Reviews.Content: There is nothing that could have been done to make our stay better. It was AMAZING!!! We had one of the best stays ever at the Hampton Inn and Suites in Vancouver. From the time we checked in until the time we checked out, the friendliness was beyond expectation. The wonderful front desk staff on Aug. 7 was amazing and friendly. I sadly don't remember their names, but they were wonderful! Our room was spotless! I am very picky about the cleanliness in a hotel room, and this room exceeded my expectations! It was spacious, comfortable and the beds were amazing! The breakfast was great. Try the blueberry jam. It was wonderful! It was fully stocked and the breakfast hostesses were very friendly! This is a wonderful hotel to stay at in Vancouver. I highly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Wish I could have stayed longer!”
Reviews.Author: cmwpm
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel. Was iin town for literally 24 hours and I needed to find somewhere to sleep. I wish I could have stayed longer so I could have taken advantage of the amenties this hotel has. The gym and hot tub look awesome, I will definitely return, and next time with my swim suit! Great views, spacious roomm, friendly front desk staff. Complimentary breakfast is a bonus. I have many food allergies, and the breakfast staff helped me out in checking exactly what I could and could not eat. A short but great stay!

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel for Teenagers”
Reviews.Author: Potteryacoma
Reviews.Content: My husband, two teenage boys and myself stayed 3 nights at this Suite hotel in Vancouver. We had a king suite with a kitchen area, living room with pull-out couch for the boys and a separate bedroom with bath. The room was large and gave us the space and privacy needed from our boys. They have a free shuttle that will take you anywhere downtown but you need to book each morning in advance. They also have free bikes for their hotel guests, but again you need to book each morning in advance. We really enjoyed our stay. The hotel is convenient all areas downtown. My husbands only complaint was the eggs at breakfast seemed they were made from a powdered mix. My boys and I found the free breakfast buffet fine, especially the waffles. I would recommend this hotel especially for families.

Reviews.Title: “Short, overnight stay, but very nice room, great view from 15th floor, friendly & helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: ClearWater62
Reviews.Content: We stayed here one night, after several days in Victoria, and boarding the Rocky Mountaineer the next morning. Front desk staff were very friendly and helpful, both at check-in and in the morning, calling a taxi for us so as to arrive almost "on cue" when we were ready to leave. The room was very nice and on an upper floor, as I had requested. We look for Hamptons when traveling, but only chose this one because it was also convenient to the train station (of prime importance to us, because of the early morning train check-in).

Reviews.Title: “Moved to this hotel from another and were very glad we did”
Reviews.Author: timbosul
Reviews.Content: We were in another hotel that was awful. We got a room here and were so glad we did. I really like Hampton Inn. The rooms are always clean, the beds very comfortable. The room was bright and cheery and overlooked the stadium across the street. Breakfast is included and they give out free newspapers. In my other hotel, I spent $70 on breakfast! We were in Vancouver for a wedding and I had rented a Chevy Suburban. There is adequate parking for oversized vehicles (i don't remember if they charged extra for parking). The hotel is close to many sights. We also shared a cab which came directly to the hotel when called by the front desk. I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Very convenient to downtown.”
Reviews.Author: weezlikestotravel
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for the weekend in March while I attended a conference. It was very convenient. I could walk to my meetings as well as to many very excellent restaurants. The free breakfast in the morning was more than adequate to help start the day. Room had refrigerator and microwave which were convenient. I opted for a room with a whirlpool tub which was very relaxing. On the frist day there, the staff brought candy to the room as a thank you. The only downside was that there was construction going on across the street (at the stadium) which was noisy. I'm not sure if this construction has stopped.

Reviews.Title: “Great downtown hotel”
Reviews.Author: e2637
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for one evening at the end of a long road trip. The room was clean and quiet with especially comfortable beds. The parking, pricey but the norm for most major cities - was very secure with gated access. My stay was excellent aside from the fact that my wakeup call never came. I missed a business conference call as a result. I mentioned this at checkout and was shocked when the manager refunded my entire hotel bill. I never expected to be offered any compensation but was pleasantly surprised and appreciative of the manager’s actions.

Reviews.Title: “Great place! Great location!”
Reviews.Author: PaulLake
Reviews.Content: This is a great location for downtown. The staff are very helpful,The room are always clean. The hot-tub on roof is fun with a nice outside area, gym is good as well. Have stayed before and will be back. We had a problem with the A/C however they gave us a free room because of the inconvience.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and amenities. A very comfortable place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: Lee060
Reviews.Content: We like the Hampton Inn chain as it is always consistent in providing a good bed and the amenities we need. This location offers free breakfast, self-service washer/dryer for $1.50/each, courtesy van one way to downtown locations as long as scheduled with front desk. We stayed here while touring Vancouver before our Alaskan cruise. It is close to the hop on/hop off trolley we used for getting to the tourist attractions in Vancouver (did not rent a car for this stay). Tour buses to areas like Victoria and Whistler will pick you up from this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great base to explore the city”
Reviews.Author: marathonman52
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on Hilton loyalty points but was still pleasantly surprised! Breakfast,Internet and shuttle service all free, and Granville island and yaletown within easy walking distance. Room was quiet and well kept, I would be happy tonstay here on business.

Reviews.Title: “Good first choice”
Reviews.Author: FionaandGordonB
Reviews.Content: Spent three nights in Vancouver at the Hampton Inn. Very pleased with choice. Clean, excellent service with large and well maintained room. Breakfast was more than satisfactory although very busy. Within walking distance of most of Downtown attractions. Vancouver very easy to get around and safe. Not cheapest city in the world but definitely worth a visit. Stanley Park is wonderful. Would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptionally helpful front desk staff”
Reviews.Author: dot2com
Reviews.Content: This hotel has the most helpful front desk staff. They function as all purpose staff and seem to do everything well. We were especially appreciative of their assistance with booking tours and suggesting activities. When we inquired about a certain activity, they whipped out a coupon for discounted admission to the activity. When asked for directions, they provided directions keeping both our pocketbook and our physical condition in mind - for example sugesting public transportation as an alternative to a 20 minute walk. They found us at breakfast to tell us that a shuttle driver couldn't take us somewhere and offered an alternative to the shuttle. They also offered to call a restaurant that wasn't answering their phone throughout the day until they got through to make a reservation for us. Rooms were comfortable with complimentary water provided. The typical Hampton breakfast was nicer than at many other Hamptons and they replenished foods - unlike another Hampton that I stayed at where you had to get down early before the fresh fruit was gone. Location was ok. There is an on-site restaurant that was very good - and provides room service!

Reviews.Title: “Sublime inner city sanctuary with class and yet so modest”
Reviews.Author: jss6270
Reviews.Content: Not your typical Hampton Inn and Suites. Much more upscale and yet so modest. Right in the heart of a vibrant and energetic city with much flair and no pretensions. The staff at the front desk were courteous, professional, knowledgable and very helpful. The suite was perfect for a family- lots of room, separate bedrooms and full kitchen with real cutlery and crockery. The location could'nt be better. Want to recommend this place so badly! Oh and btw check out the fantastic hot tub- very modern design- on the top floor with stunning views of the city and BC Place. You can pretty much leave your car in the garage and just walk, bus or hop the train to see the sights and delights of this great city.

Reviews.Title: “Best Jacuzzi Tub Around”
Reviews.Author: YanniBananni
Reviews.Content: First time I've stayed here; I have booked family into this property before and never got any complaints so I figured I'd give it a whirl. Vancouver is famous for its void of any really great hotels so rather than be disappointed after spending $400-700 at a hotel that just doesn't get it, I'd be loyal to Hilton and save some money. Turns out the hotel was actually pretty good. Free-Wifi: big check. Can't stand hotels that nickel and dime you for wifi. nice corner room with wall to wall windows that look out onto...renovations on a stadium. Kind of cool looking, actually but if you're into looking at the gorgeous vancouver mountains this isn't the place. The service, though, is really good at this hotel. First, they upgraded me from the standard two queen room that I booked online to a better one king deluxe room. It also included a free breakfast that I must say was fairly decent if you like healthy breakfasts; cereals, fruit, good coffee. Apparently they can make you an omelette if you want. Anyway, the breakfast was free so for the money it was a thumbs up. I extended my stay another two nights and they upgraded me again at no charge and moved some other reservations around so I could keep the same room. Very courteous, very friendly people at the front desk every time I dealt with them. There's a good size fridge in the room - nice and cold for beer, and also a small microwave. There's no room service, however; I had to call a pizza delivery service but I was in the mood for pizza so it worked out okay. The best part of the room, though, is absolutely the jacuzzi tub. These guys really did a nice job with the tub in the bathroom. It is really a nice size and fits two really comfortably. The tub fills up very quickly and the water is deep. The jets have two speeds. The tub was exactly what I needed after 17 hours of flying. The location of the hotel is pretty ideal. Yaletown is a 5 minute walk; gastown is a 10 minute walk, and Robson Street shopping is 5 minutes away, also. The fitness facility on the top floor is quite interesting. They have both a ping pong and foosball table which was a nice surprise. They also have a decent hot tub. no pool, though. The only negative thing I would submit is that the parking seems very expensive: $25/night for secured underground self-parking; you can come and go as you please which is a plus, though.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, highly recommended!”
Reviews.Author: professorroyhinkley
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a nice surprise. We saw a lot of reviews for other Vancouver hotels that talked about small rooms - not here. We had a 1 br suite and it was really nice and roomy. The staff was excellent and very helpful, especially one person (I wish I got her name!) The sink had trouble getting hot water or pressure, which was strange because the shower didn't seem to have an issue. Bed comfort, fridge, heat all worked as hoped. Breakfast seemed to be a notch higher than expected - and they didn't have a problem with me stopping in a little early! The area was wonderful - we had a view of the stadium (right across the street) and could walk to 1000 restaurants that seemed to be open early to late. Easy walking to shopping, longer walk to the aquarium & convention center. The walk was good - past coffee shops & stores. The only negative was the expensive parking - $25/day & tough to find a space unless you have a tiny car. Otherwise, I'd highly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value”
Reviews.Author: Selbourn
Reviews.Content: Most helpful pleasant staff. Excellent Value for money. Very convenient location. Most strongly recommended

Reviews.Title: “great location, fine accomodatons, helpful staff and excellent breakfast available”
Reviews.Author: wickedheadache
Reviews.Content: Try the Chop House restaurant across from the hotel along with Frank's Italian restaurant next door. Both offer excellent cuisine and a pleasant atmosphere

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: cf_travellers
Reviews.Content: Service at the front desk was wonderful when we checked in. The room was so beautiful. We were on the 9th floor and had a corner jacuzzi suite. The view from our room was amazing, we had two full walls of windows. Very clean room and a super comfortable bed. Wi-fi internet connection was bad, we couldn't get a signal. Breakfast was really good and included with the room. There was pancakes, waffles, sausage, fruit, yogurt, hard boiled eggs, bagels, toast, scones, juice, coffee, tea. It was the biggest complimentary breakfast buffet I have ever seen at a hotel. We loved this hotel so much that we would definitely stay here again the next time we are in Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Webwill
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hampton for a total of 3 nights. It is just a wonderful Hotel and I couldn't find fault with it at all. Breakfasts are great, staff good - friendly and helpful. Great location, clean, lovely rooms. Free bikes (biked to and around Stanley Park - really recommend this). Bikes come with helmets, backpack, water and a map - fantastic. I would really recommend this Hotel as found it excellent value for money. Would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “A little disappointed by this Hampton Inn”
Reviews.Author: happytravelpal
Reviews.Content: I usually rave about Hampton Inn's and Hilton properties in general. However, I was a little underwhelmed by my recent stay here in Vancouver. The staff were mostly pleasant but in no way were they extra friendly or accommodating. While the two free truffles for HHonors were indeed delicious - real, warm, genuine service would have left a sweeter taste in this reviewers mouth. We booked and received a 1 bedroom suite. The only redeeming feature in my mind was the standard Hampton bed which is always comfortable. The room itself needed a major overhaul. The carpet and sofa bed in particular were looking quite worn and sad. There were hairs stuck to the ceiling above the shower when we arrived. Long black hairs. Not the kind of thing you expect for $230 a night. The shower itself was also disappointing with poor water pressure and woeful drainage. Standing ankle deep in water is not something I would expect and do not appreciate from this hotel chain. Noise is an issue in this hotel. Neighbors can be heard, air conditioning can be heard (even when the room A/C is off) and most notably - rattling of pipes can be heard. I found the breakfast to be quite good by Hampton standard. The usual fare was there and everything was frequently refilled. Complimentary use of the hotel bikes was appreciated and the gentleman who assisted us with these was the standout of staff we encountered. Parking was just over $25 a night to self park. Aside from the two truffles at check-in there were no perks for HHonors gold members which was a little disappointing. With the service and value absent at this property it is unlikely we will stay again when visiting Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and Room”
Reviews.Author: snoopy647
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a 1 bedroom suite with a girlfriend as we were over for the Bon Jovi concert. Had stayed there the month before with my husband in a studio room, and were very pleased. The 1 bedroom is very spacious with full kitchen and breakfast bar. The bedroom was very large and had lots of closet space. The bedroom had a large TV as well as the living room. After our check in we were down at the front desk inquiring on which way to walk to Pacific Centre Shopping Mall. They have a shuttle which was dropping someone else off at a different location, so they told us we could hop a ride with it. What a nice surprise! Later in the afternoon a staff member arrived at our suite with "welcome back" chocolates. The breakfast buffet the next morning was good, and had a lovely selection of items. I would definately stay there again next time we go to a concert as so close to BC Place and Rogers Arena. The one thing I wish they would do would be to include parking in their room price.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and service”
Reviews.Author: Nessie5
Reviews.Content: Arrived at 8:30am and they managed to find us a room which was great after a 15 hr flight. Room was spacious and clean. Location of hotel was walking distance to everything. Great value, would definately stay here again and recommend to others.

Reviews.Title: “Always Enjoyed my Stay - Great Location”
Reviews.Author: prbimaniac
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here several times in the last few months. Staff are great. Rooms are good. Location is walking distance to Yaletown downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, clean hotel, friendly staff.”
Reviews.Author: yehaaw
Reviews.Content: The Hampton Inn is located right in the heart of the city. I didn't need a car because of its location. Across the street from BC Place, Rogers Arena, and close to many restaurants. The rooms are SPOTLESS. VERY CLEAN. The hotel has a great workout room that has a sauna, hot tub, laundry facilities, and a great view. Do not hesitate to stay at this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great location for Rogers Arena, BC Place and QE Theatre”
Reviews.Author: snoopy647
Reviews.Content: Chose this hotel because of proximity to Rogers Arena (Eric Clapton concert) and reviews on Trip Advisor. Stayed in a room with a king size bed. Very roomy, including the bathroom. Bathroom had a night light and makeup mirror which was nice. Room included a mini fridge and microwave that many would find handy. WIFI worked great. Huge window which actually opened. Very spacious breakfast area with a good selection of items. I think it would be better to have parking included, as $25 extra.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, friendly staff.”
Reviews.Author: Tabaxi
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hampton Inn and Suites as it was close to Rogers Arena as we had tckets to a game. It was great. Very easy to get around, friendly staff, a nice serve yourself breakfast. The room was comfortable. We had a king suite. We found it very quiet but we were on the 7th floor. The whirlpool and sauna were fun, plus tried the ping pong with my 13 year old son.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: Bima
Reviews.Content: This is a good midrange hotel for anyone planning to attend a hockey game, or any event at Rogers Arena or BC Place (when it's finished). Rooms are average-sized, with excellent beds, lots of pillows, free wi-fi, and a safe. The included buffet breakfast is very good. The lobby contains a kiosk for airline check-in, which is a great convenience. In good weather, it's an easy walk up to Robson or Granville Streets for galleries, shopping, etc. This is a comfortable hotel in a very convenient location.

Reviews.Title: “Great find”
Reviews.Author: cwl40
Reviews.Content: Loved this hotel. Great location near Yaletown. Free bike hire for guests. Good breakfast, rec room with hot tub and laundry. The room was very comfortable

Reviews.Title: “Tough to beat!”
Reviews.Author: JJ_McQ
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this downtown hotel for 5 days this month. Great location although at the bottom of Robson Street, but not a far walk to dining and shopping. Staff were attentive, complimentary breakfast was great, rooms clean and not dated. Would not hesitate to recommend this spot for out of towners. The $20 underground parking fee is a bit of a grab though.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Jimgotkp
Reviews.Content: The complimentary water, breakfast, and internet were awesome. It's near the stadium and Chinatown. The rooms were spacious with the flat screen, microwave and fridge. The room was clean upon arrival as well. The negatives were the underground parking since the handicapped space is on the bottom level (P3) instead of the top one (P1). It's quite hard for a handicapped person to drive in a pretty tight garage. Instead of having parking for small cars they should make it for handicapped people. The second negative is the breakfast even though it's free. They need to put the breakfast in a larger space since it was packed when I went. I didn't see such offerings like bacon like other reviewers reported. The price seems to be pretty high for this property but it was at $155 for NYE which is VERY cheap when comparing it to other similar properties. Being a city hotel though not surprised it's a bit more expensive. However, don't forget to have an additional $19 daily fee for parking.

Reviews.Title: “Great nights stay just before we went on a cruise/Near the train station too”
Reviews.Author: aswessen
Reviews.Content: Our family needed a place to stay prior to boarding a cruise to Alaska. We got a nice two room suite, so the teens stayed in one room and parents in another. The room had a mini kitchen and with the addition of a rollaway bed, plenty of room for all 4 of us. Breakfast was both ample and had great variety. Eggs, yogurt, cereal, fruit, waffles. My only complaint was it was overcrowded and hard to get a table. The hotel was also close to the train station where we disembarked so the cab ride was reasonable. I am only sorry we didnt have more time to explore Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Wow!”
Reviews.Author: MitchBlock
Reviews.Content: Was in Vancouver for a special concert given by a friend of mine, who told me that this is the place to stay. I am from the US originally, and when I think of Hampton I think of a suburban type hotel. Suburban this isn`t. All the good amenities of a Hampton, with great service, and an excellent location as well. (I feel like I`m in one of those Holiday Inn comercials.) I had a great time here.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ridersfan23
Reviews.Content: When staying in vancouver I've always chosen between Pacific Palisades (which is no longer), a sheraton or a westin. I use to stay at this hampton back quite a few years ago when I was in town a lot. It was a great hotel then and its still a great hotel now. The staff at the front are always so helpful their customer service skills are exceptional. Since the renos this hotel is really great especially if your taking in a hockey game which is a quick walk down beatty street to the game. Fantastic. The breakfast is a nice treat also!!! Great comfy, exceptional hotel! Keep up the great work!

Reviews.Title: “Nearly a "Five"- Great Location, Very Good Stay”
Reviews.Author: AnacoTraveler
Reviews.Content: We traveled by train from the Puget Sound area to see a play in Vancouver in late October. The Hampton is a terrific home base, just a short taxi or Skytrain ride from the central station. It's location next to BC Place and within walking distance of lots of restaurants, theaters, shopping,etc work well for almost any activity. It is a little challenging to figure out where the entrance is, but one way or the other you eventually get in. Front desk service was excellent for check in , check out and for concierge service. We have stayed here before and dining recommendations have always been spot on. At least half a dozen newspapers are complementary each day if you just have to know what is going on in the world. The complementary breakfast is served upstairs from the lobby in a space that could be enlarged for a hotel of this size. The breakfast is a very good upgrade continental, with eggs, bacon, waffles, fresh fruit, carbs, juices and coffee. There is a decent enough bar and restaurant in the hotel. The rooms are large and efficiently if not exactly elegantly decorated. Bottles of water and coffee / tea are complementary. Wired and wireless Internet is also complementary although the day we were there it was pretty sluggish. The beds and linens were above average although it loses points for the towels which are not remotely commensurate with this quality of hotel or room rate. Everything was clean and functional, lots of TV channels on flat screens, and nice views. Although this can be a very busy area of town, it is quiet inside the building. Improvements: Already mentioned the towels and while you get a lot of complementary ammenities, it is not an inexpensive place to stay, including nearly 16% taxes and fees ( what the heck is a destination marketing fee and why am I paying it?). But given its overall quality and location it only gets docked a little for value. We have always found Hampton to be a quality operation, if a bit pricy, and this one is no different.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, quite stay”
Reviews.Author: TechGuy123
Reviews.Content: To get to the hotel, we took the Airport train all the way and got off at China town and then walked the remaining distance - I believe you can travel to the Rogers Arena which might be a little closer but we couldn’t see the stop on the map. While we were excited to make our first stop in Canada, the distance was a little far and on reflection the hotel was quite a walk from most of the entertainment. The hotel is about 10mins away from Granville area and right across the road from BC Place and the Rogers Arena - an excellent choice if you plan on seeing an event. We booked a double queen which was quite spacious and included a large bathroom and separate wardrobe (?) containing a kitchenette. This was a nice touch although we only used the fridge and ate out most of the time. The view from our room (9th floor) was awesome and you could see right into the BC Place stadium which is currently having some work done to add a retractable roof. We stayed over a weekend and the noise from the workmen was only noticeable on the Monday Morning. Being at the end of Beatty Street it was quite out of the distance but it meant that street noise was at a bare minimum and we always got a good night’s sleep. Free wireless internet in the room is a bonus although a given in a hotel of this type and assisted in our planning for the day ahead. Maid Service didn’t arrive too early in the morning which is a positive for the night owls and each morning they provide complimentary papers and bottles of water in addition to new towels. It is satisfying to receive double-towels for that night time shower given that most hotels are now restricting their linen arrangement. The decor was welcoming (although I wasn’t that bothered) and the beds were super comfortable - exactly what I needed after many days of walking the city. When turning the A/C off I couldn't help but notice an odour in the room. I can't remember if I had specifically asked for a non-smoking room but there was definitely that type of smell in the air. Breakfast was the usual buffet arrangement with scrambled eggs and waffles provided most mornings in addition to a meat item and the common cereal and juice/tea. I don't remember seeing a set restaurant in the building as we ate out each night. I would definitely recommend this hotel and would certainly consider it again when I visit.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: lovetatravellots
Reviews.Content: The hotel is perfect, location is amazing right across from BC Place. The breakfast is great. Stayed for a week in September 2009 and loved it, would be happy to return

Reviews.Title: “Definitely the bet kept secret in downtown Vancouver!”
Reviews.Author: OyBO2010
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 5 nights at the beginning of October 2010. It was a wonderful experience. The room was very clean with an extremely comfortable bed. The staff were very friendly and helpful. They allowed me to check in earlier and gave me a room immediately because they had one ready. I had a microwave oven and a fridge which was handy for my takeaway meals. There is a very nice retaurant conveniently located on the ground floor of the hotel and they deliver meals to the room when you order. I was attending a conference at the Canada Place Convention Centre and the hotel offered me a free shuttle bus every morning and to whatever other location I wanted to go to downtown as many times as I wanted to go. Also had free hot breakfast (limited choice but good all the same) and free internet. And all this for under $160.00 per night! In addition the hotel is walking distance to many of the restaurants and shops in downtown Vancouver. None of my colleagues attending the conference had such a good deal. No downsides for me, would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable Stay”
Reviews.Author: Markate
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hampton for 3 nights at the start of a driving holiday round the Rockies and found it to be very good value. Staff were very friendly and helpful, especially Andrew who organised a last minute whale watching trip for us and dropped us at a bank and to Granville Island. Our room was spacious and clean with plenty of towels. As others have mentioned, the breakfast area is small and busy but has more than enough choice. We ate at Zacharys restaurant attached to the hotel one evening and had a good meal with 10% discount. We also ate at Yaletown, a short distance away with many restaurants. The hotel is in a good position and we walked everywhere.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location and Serv”
Reviews.Author: ater42
Reviews.Content: The location is good for most of the city sights. Our room was a good size for a city centre hotel and the service was friendly and helpful. The only negative aspect was the breakfast which was included in our room rate. The size of the breakfast room was about a quarter of the size needed for a hotel this size. Also as there was no check I suspect that a number of people just came in off the street for a free breakfast. The food was generally unhealthy even by north American standards and the quality should have been better.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay for a downtown Vancouver visit”
Reviews.Author: Leeskibike
Reviews.Content: Attended a conference in Vancouver; my spouse and 3 year old son came with me. We stayed in a 1 bedroom suite with a kitchenette. We got a full-size crib rental for our son from bambinobabyrentals.com; they delivered the crib for free to the hotel because it was downtown. It was set up in the room when we checked in, which was nice. I tilted the couch on end and draped blankets and comforters from it to other places to make a sleeping area for our son in a corner of the living room. We didn't use the kitchenette as much as we could have; everything was available for meal preparation, including a full-size refrigerator. One reason the kitchenette was underused was the excellent free breakfast buffet. There was free Internet access via two terminals (with printers available) adjacent to the breakfast area. There is a SkyTrain station two blocks from the motel, which made it simple to get to the motel from the airport, and which I used every day to go to the conference at Canada Place. There is a grocery store a short distance up Robson from the motel. The motel had hybrid bicycles and helmets available for free; it was nice to check one out one day and take a ride around the perimeter of Stanley Park. The motel staff were very nice, friendly people. My spouse and son rode a free shuttle one day from the motel to Stanley Park. A coin laundry is available on the top floor, where the fitness center (with hot tub) also is located. It's a short walk to False Creek, where the little ferries offer service to Granville Island, etc.

Reviews.Title: “just a perfect stay....”
Reviews.Author: robo16888
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hampton downtown from aug14-21,2010, with my parents (3 adults). our room price was very reasonable at $159/night pre-paid at least 1 month in advance, (i avoided the hst tax by pre-paying before the hst kicked in). we had just got off the cruise ships. bought my 'big bus' hop-on-hop-off tickets from near Canada Place where the cruise port is. and the 'Bug Bus' dropped us off 30 feet from the hotel door at the foot of Robson St across from BC Place (where the BC Lions football plays). we got there about 11am, so our room wasn't ready, they did their best to accomadate us, and our room was ready at 1pm. our room was very clean and spacious with 2 queen beds, facing directly onto BC Place. it has a complimentary coffee maker, and 2 bottles of complimentary water, and a bar fridge/freezer, and a lockable room safe. i needed a freezer for my alaska salmon. it has a 32" flat screen tv. the AC was working very well, as the week was very hot and humid at nights. the complimentary buffet breakfast was also very good, with standard coffee/tea, OJ, and apple juice, milk. sometimes scrambled eggs, somtimes easy over, and hash brown potatoes (something different everyday), and a waffle-maker, toaster, yogurt, and bananas, and apples. you can sleep-in and still catch the breakfast till 10am. it has 2 computers and a printer with free internet access for half hour segments, until you re-login again, (I guess so that you don't hog the pc). it has a fountain in the lobby so you can refill your water bottles. the lobby and front desk area is kind of small tho. there's a gift shop, and a burgar and steak restraurant with live nightly music/band. there's an ice machine on a different floor and coin laundry on the 16th floor with a games room with ping pong table, and foosball table, and several seating chairs, and a few excercise machines. the games/excercise room has a door that can go outside onto a rooftop patio, with a couple of bench tables over looking bc place. there's a small 4 foot deep pool, and another door to a smaller patio. Susan, at the front desk was very nice to me and my parents, and she told me all the best places to see and do. also this hampton, was within walking distance to the edgwater casino. you can get complimentary coupon book at the front desk for free cab to the casino, and free $10 slot play, and $10 table plays, (my parents like to walk to the casino to get their excercise). in a strange hotel and environment, it usually takes me 2 or 3 nights to get used to the bed and room, i slept like a baby EVERY night for 7 nights. in the same week, my sister and her family stayed at the westin grande, and i think they paid $200+/night, cosmetically it looks nice, but they dont get the continental breakfast. as they say, the breakfast is the most important meal to start your day. so hope they had a good day and good stay as we did. we're extremely happy we stayed at this hampton, and we definetly will be coming back next time. i relied entirely on tripadvisor and other ppl's comments. so thanks to all the previous comments. anyways, DO YOUR RESEARCH! Thank you again Susan.

Reviews.Title: “No complaints! Good location and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: rand415
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I just returned home from a 4 day trip to Vancouver. We stayed at the Hampton Inn during this time. While it is not exactly in the heart of downtown Vancouver, it's so close that it was worth it for the reduced cost/night plus free breakfast. The hotel staff was very accommodating and friendly, and there was even an on-site shuttle that took us to the local downtown sites we wanted to see. All we had to do was tip the driver, which isn't a necessity, but he was super nice too so we wanted to say thanks. The hotel room - we stayed on the 7th floor - didn't have wonderful views but we were able to see all the sites in our own travels so we didn't care to have a great view from our room. In our eyes, if you're spending too much time in the room, you're not enjoying the wonderful scenery outdoors enough! Anyway, the room was clean, and had a mini fridge and microwave, which was helpful when we had leftovers. This hotel is in a quieter part of the city, which was nice at night when we actually did want to go to sleep. Here are some things we did while staying in the city that you may want to try: -Yaletown - we found this area to be the most suited to our tastes (older 20-somethings to younger to mid 30-somethings). Upscale restaurants, great bars, good scenery and people watching. We ate lunch at Milestones in Yaletown, which was great. I know they have a deal for every day of the week. I think Wed was date night where all bottles of wine are $5 off. We also ate at Earl's (great patio with heat lamps and blankets if you want one!), Yaletown Pub & Brewery, and another tapas/sushi place whose name escapes me. Definitely check out the rooftop patio at The Keg - we loved this place. The drinks aren't cheap but they didn't seem to be cheap anywhere. The staff was incredibly friendly (and good looking!!), and the views from the roof were fantastic. -Yuk Yuk's Comedy Club - went on a Saturday night. This is located at a hotel downtown (again, I forget the name but you can probably look it up). I found it very funny and enjoyed the "different' humor. We're from the States so the jokes some of the comedians cracked about Canada and Vancouver sometimes went over our heads, but for the most part it was very entertaining. Make a reservation in advance if you want to visit. -Granville Island - we went kayaking through EcoMarine for 2.5 hours (creek tour). Fun time - not cheap. Also, take note that if you make a reservation in advance, if you need to change days (we did due to rain on the initial day we booked), they charge you $10 if you're 48 hours from your original booking. Seemed silly but we paid it and enjoyed it. The shops are cute to visit - we didn't eat at the market since it was so crowded to walk through. Instead we went to Go Fish, this little stand that was recommended by our kayak instructor. The BEST fish and chips we had out there. We also tried the tomato soup and the sesame crusted tuna sandwich. The line for this place was super long, as I've heard it always is, and the wait to get your food after you order takes about 15-20 mins, but it was delicious and not all that expensive! Highly recommended. -Stanley Park - we rented bicycles and rode the seawall. I don't ride often so I was a bit nervous, but it was easy riding and gorgeous scenery. The food at the park was very expensive so we didn't eat there but I heard people packing picnics. Try that! Also, if you rent a bike, make sure to shop around. We found a place that was cheaper than some others, but didn't offer flat tire service in case you get a flat while you're out in the park. We took the risk and everything was fine so we ended up saving some money. -Granville Street - many bars and clubs on this street that are hot on Friday/Saturdays, but we're not much into the clubbing scene so we decided to walk around the street to check out what goes on there. Since the drinking age is a bit younger in Canada than home for us, there seemed to be many younger people (18-early 20's) totally wasted wandering the streets. In just the 2 blocks we walked, we witnessed a girl almost puke, two guys being broken up from getting into a fight, people drinking in the streets, and girls with dresses so short and tight that I was amazed they could breathe. Interesting to walk through, but Yaletown felt less wild and crazy to us. Totally a personal preference and I'm sure the club scene is a lot of fun, but it was definitely wild :-) Was fun to check out though! Aside from that, we spent a lot of time at the English Bay beach and some of the parks in the area. I highly recommend laying on a blanket and just relaxing out there, or bringing picnic food and staying to watch the sunset. Just beautiful.

Reviews.Title: “The Best.......”
Reviews.Author: TheInnocentBystander
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for almost 4 weeks from June 2010 to middle of July 2010......as I suffered a concusion at work and was sent to Vancouver to a clinic. This hotel is a gem in downtown Vancouver. I have stayed just up the street on Robson at a few different hotels and nothing comes close value wise. First off....it is quiet. I was only there from Sun to Thurs so I can't comment on the weekends but during the week in was great. With my concussion I needed a quiet hotel and this fit the bill to a T. The beds are awesome as most Hamptons are. There is a ping pong table and foos ball table......weights...treadmill and hot tub & sauna rooftop..you can sit in the hot tub and see inside BC PLace as the roof is being replaced at the stadium. Or sit out and enjoy a starlit night on the deck. The breakfast was awesome..always hot..I always ate early though so can't comment if you are eating later but if you eat a free breakfast at any hotel you will find it crowded, You can walk anywhere......Chinatown,Yaletown....sky train...Canada line. On Beatty Street on one side of the hotel you can always get a cab as it is a waiting location for one of the cab companys, Too far to walk to English Bay/Stanley Park but a cab there is only around $8.00. The staff went out of their way to make sure my stay was a good one.....especially Susan at the front desk and Lauren the sale manager. I pre-paid for one of the weeks but ended up having to have dental surgery back home. They could have kept my money but instead reworked my stay into the following week. After staying there 20 days I don't have one bad thing to say about them.

Reviews.Title: “Overall great hotel, just pricey for a Hampton”
Reviews.Author: techfan
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a week in Victoria and Vancouver and stayed at the Hampton Inn in Vancouver. For us the location was great, we are not cruisers and did not want to stay near the cruise docks and crowds. The location is in between two rails stops and within walking distance of Yaletown (many restaurants) and Gastown. The hotel has 4 complimentary bikes that you can use for 3 hours which was plenty of time to ride the seawall from Yaletown area all the way around Stanley Park. (Remember to ride counter clockwise!) Our room was very quiet and overlooked BC stadium. Yes, the breakfast room is on the small side but they do their best to accomodate everyone as best they can. The food was very typical of the Hampton chain. Vancouver in general seems to have a problem with homeless and pan handling - read other posts about this and pay attention to your surroundings. We had no problems around the hotel, mainly Chinatown and Gastown. We did have the fire alarm go off at 3:30 AM and had to walk down from the 11th floor! We heard someone was smoking in a non-smoking room and set off the alarm. All was handled well, just a delay in unlocking the elevators (my husband has walking issues and had to wait for the elevators). My only complaint was the price but when researching hotels it just appears that Vancouver is a very expensive place to stay. They have coin operated washers and dryers on the 16th floor as well as an exercise room, whirlpool with incredible view and roof deck.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good”
Reviews.Author: ziggydssp
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in July for 2 nights. I would say it's an okay hotel worth no more than $135 per night. It was clean, pretty quiet and the staff were sufficient but not great. The shuttle driver had a bit of attitude which turned me off. The breakfast was okay but not anything too good to brag about. The danish were cold and hard and they kept running out of milk. There is not much seating for peak hours. The location of the hotel is at the southern extreme of the main tourist district. It's quite a hoof to Stanley Park or other area to the north. The hotel is close to Yaletown which has lots of dining options. We tried Simply Thai and Yaltwown Brewery and both were very good.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, comfortable and perfect for our trip”
Reviews.Author: justjayce
Reviews.Content: This was our overnight stop off point prior to our cruise. I picked this hotel because it had a free shuttle to the cruise terminal, a big bonus, and I could burn some of my Hilton points as Vancouver is very very expensive. Check-in was easy and the people were friendly. The room was nice and the bed was comfy. There were free bottles of water in the room which was a nice touch, and plenty of choices on the TV. At first the internet was not working - other patrons were complaining about it. So instead of coming back to tripadvisor to find a place to eat I asked the front desk. They steered us towards southwest of the hotel (Hamilton street) where there were lots of trendy shops and eateries where the hamburgers start at $15 USD. Was not interested and considering their eateries were mainly empty not many others were at that time either. Robson street was the answer. There were several "cheaper eats" along the road including the Japadog restaurant which I now regret missing out on. When we got back the internet still was not working for me, but we were able to get the wired connection up after calling their tech support. I was worried that the evening was going to be a loud one since there was a heavy metal concert going on nearby. We did hear lots of people shouting before the concert, but didn't hear anything in the evening. Must have been dead tired. The breakfast in the morning was one of the best set up I had ever seen at a Hampton. The second floor of the lobby area was all for breakfast and the selections were plentiful. Our shuttle to Canada Pier was easy and free - which saved us a cab ride or a train ride/walk if we stayed anywhere else. The staff were friendly and the service was good - I have no complaints other than the internet wasn't working right for me and others.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent 4 star hotel in convenient downtown Vancouver location”
Reviews.Author: AussieTraveller56
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent 6 nights at the Hampton Inn & Suites, in 3 stays of 2 nights each, as part of a package booking around Rocky Mountaineer train trips and an Alaskan cruise. We had 3 different rooms, all of which were of a very high standard - large, comfortable and clean. The included breakfast buffet was good, and the reception staff very pleasant and helpful. The location was good for exploring Vancouver, and the hotel was within walking distance of the SkyTrain to the airport. No complaints whatsoever. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: kelsek
Reviews.Content: Well situated in downtown vancouver, this hotel has very friendly service and great rooms. Walking distance from market and other ammenties. Good rates and very comfortable beds. Fire alarm went off twice but other wise it is very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Don't misss the view from the 16th floor”
Reviews.Author: tafuti
Reviews.Content: Stop shopping for a place to stay in Vancover if you want a great experience. When you check into this hotel not only are you getting a room but a personal travel guide when you meet Ryan Christopher and Andrew behind the counter. Their recommendations on what to do in Vancouver is amazing. They took into consideration that we were traveling with a teenager and found a comedy club we could get into and set up a perfect evening in Vancover. Don't miss an opportunity to go out with Hampton's excellent and entertaining driver Andrew. He gives you great insight to the city and makes your time with him interesting and makes you feel like you got to see Vancouver from a proud Canadian. The complimentary breakfast is excellent and very nicely presented. The biggest wow moment is when we went to the 16th floor and saw the most magnificent view of the city. Don't know of another hotel where you can sit in the jacuzzi and see the entire city. What a view and a hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A Credit To Canadian Tourism”
Reviews.Author: Kendallclan
Reviews.Content: After arriving tired and weary from a 14 hour direct flight from Australia at 8 a.m., my husband and I were warmly welcomed to this excellent hotel with an early check-in and crawled into the ultra-comfortable bed for a nap before exploring the nearby delights of Vancouver. The hotel is an easy walk to the shopping precinct and an extensive range of restaurants, bars and convenience stores.
