The room was perfect with expansive windows, tasteful decor and a pristine, roomy bathroom - plus, large screen TV, table & chairs etc. When we returned for a three day stay at the end of our vacation, we were provided with a room which provided the benefit of a kitchenette with microwave, crockery etc. The complimentary breakfast (a rarity these days) was of a very high standard with a surprising array of goodies and, if one is sensible enough to choose an off-peak time, provided a relaxing and sustaining start to the day. We dined at the downstairs restaurant/bar and were impressed with the friendly, hospitable staff - as were the front desk attendants. They provided a friendly, relaxed and warm stay and this hotel cannot be praised highly enough. Canadian tourism generally proved to be excellent throughout our holiday and we will be recommending Hampton Inn and Suites and Canada generally as an ideal vacation destination. Thank you, - The Kendalls

Reviews.Title: “Hampton Inn is always a consistent choice”
Reviews.Author: gypsytravels
Reviews.Content: Free internet, complimentary breakfast and consistent service make the Hampton Inn a choice hotel for travel within Canada. I find that the rooms are always new and clean and the service is good. The location on Robson was ideal for two days of downtown meetings with all being within walking distance. I will stay at this hotel whenever traveling in Vancouver for business

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!!!!”
Reviews.Author: SugarnFlower
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 5 days in Feb 2009 for the Vancouver Boat Show. This was a fabulous hotel. Beautiful room, nice staff, comfortable beds, clean hotel overall. We will stay with them again hands down. Highly recommended!!!! Great place to stay for hockey games and lots of great pubs, bars etc within walking distance. Just a nice clean, comfortable hotel overall. :)

Reviews.Title: “Great location for concerts”
Reviews.Author: cynlouhoo
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at the Hampton and since we were so happy with the first stay, we had high expectations this time. We arrived a little early, but not too much before the official check in time. We were there with another couple (seperate rooms) and they were told their reserved room wasn't available, but they managed to get another room.....they never said anything to us, but just gave us a room. Turns out both our rooms were RIGHT next to the elevator....like touching. We went down and got different rooms, but one of them was on the 4th floor and definately lacked the view. We managed to scoop the higher floor room with the better view. As usual the bed was VERY comfortable, and they have a large, flat screen TV in the room. Bathroom decent with the curved shower rod and peek-a-boo shower curtain to avoid any of those "Psycho" moments. Pretty decent access to ice machines, but plastic cups in the room. All was going fairly well until breakfast rolled around and a large group of hungover concert goers were faced with a very horribly managed breakfast "buffet". Items were not replenished quickly, and in some cases not at all. It was sad. And this was one of our highlights last time! All in all, it was a decent stay and the location is perfect for concerts.....especially if the concert is at BC Place (this time we went to GM Place).

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for BC Place.”
Reviews.Author: RavennaEvans
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay at this hotel, and it will not be my last -- this is a great hotel for attending concerts at BC Place Stadium. It's right across the street from the venue, nothing closer except the Georgian (which is usually booked by the roadies of the band, at least in U2's case). Check-in was a breeze, took all of 30 seconds, and check-out was even faster. Parking was super convenient in the garage, although kind of pricey. We didn't get up early enough to eat breakfast, so I can't attest to the included breakfast -- we ended up walking two blocks or so to McDonalds. The room itself was wonderful: nicely decorated with clean, white bedspreads and down pillows. Flat screen TV, beautiful bathroom, not bad water pressure. The best part of the room, however, was that two whole walls were glass windows, floor to ceiling, looking over BC Place (we were on the 10th floor). What a view! Admittedly, it wasn't looking onto anything really cool like a pretty city view, but it made keeping an eye on the proceedings of the concert below super easy (so we could decide when to go down to the venue without having to wait in line). My only complaint would be the lack of a decent sit-down restaurant at the hotel. All in all a great experience!

Reviews.Title: “Fine. but...”
Reviews.Author: socalbeachbum97
Reviews.Content: If you need a place to rest your head, then this place is fine. Excellent location if you plan on going to a Canucks game. Other than that, the rooms are very plain, small, and suffocating. The location isn't that great for most sightseeing in Vancouver. And the free breakfast? A completely chaotic experience. You get what you pay for here. And the views are undesirable. The opposite end of Robson St. has a lot more to offer. Skip the restaurant. The food and service is lousy.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient affordable nice clean hotel downtown”
Reviews.Author: kyh86
Reviews.Content: This was our first time staying at a Hampton Inn & Suites within the Hilton chain, and it was a most pleasant experience supported by many reviews by TripAdvisor members. Nice helpful reception and efficient check-in. Located just off the stadium on the east end of Robson St, it is a short walk to the main shopping area but on the night that we arrived, there was a musical event outside the stadium due to a major football match that day. Thankfully that ended by about 7pm otherwise the noise would be unbearable, and otherwise the rooms were quiet and no traffic noise was noticed. Self parking is CAD17 per day which is reasonable for downtown. Rooms (we had two kingsize bedrooms) were spacious, clean and bright with very comfortable beds (two queens in one room, and one King in another), free inroom wireless, flatscreen TV and a nice lap-rest for using the notebook in bed. Airconditioning was very efficient and quiet - there is even a humidity control feature. Toilet/shower bathroom clean and spacious enough as well. Large In-room safe. Free coffee/tea making facilities in the room and free bottles of water each day. All rooms include hot breakfast which has a good selection of quality cereals, pastry, some fruits but poor quality of hot meals (weird plastic looking fried eggs that don't even look like proper eggs, and poor quality of sausage or meat patties - only one type available each day). Good selection of teas and coffees which are freely available to-go as well. We were happy with the experience except for that weird fried egg which we all (4 or us adults) agreed was not worth even a try.

Reviews.Title: “great stay”
Reviews.Author: tripfoot
Reviews.Content: very good stay on way in to Canada and up to Whistler. clean, great amenities, and excellent service. in great location.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff and good location.”
Reviews.Author: Jojicat
Reviews.Content: Good sized suite that was perfect for my early rising husband to have his space without disturbing my beauty sleep. Comfortable bed, clean bathroom and quiet location. We didn't have the breakfast as my husband prefers a cooked breakfast and what little is provided didn't look that great. However if you're happy with Continental breakfast it looked fine. There is limited space in the breakfast room which could be a problem if the hotel was busy. Reception staff were friendly and helpful. Provide free shuttle around town. Would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great room with a view!”
Reviews.Author: skydivehockey
Reviews.Content: Our room was a large king, corner room (12th floor, I think) with floor to ceiling windows on two sides overlooking downtown Vancouver. Staff at front desk, bellhop, etc. were all very helpful and friendly (it was our first visit to Vancouver). Very quiet. One of the few hotels with free internet in rooms. Would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location for Leisure Traveller”
Reviews.Author: pr123
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were in Vancouver for 3 days getting our daughter set up in university. We booked the Hampton Inn as we wanted a suite and they offered the best rate for a branded hotel downtown. The hotel is not large, but well located across from BC Place and only 3 or 4 blocks walk from Yaletown (a great place for dinner or nightlife). That was a pleasant surprise, as I expected to be a bit out of the way. The room was as expected for Hampton; clean and functional. The front desk staff were friendly. The hotel offers free hot breakfast, which was OK. I can't recall how it compares with other Hampton Inns (its been a while), but we found the selection very limited and it was very busy. (Basically a continental breakfast with 1 hot item; eggs one day and waffles the next.) The other minor annoyance was the parking; it is very tight to get into/out of and there are limited spaces. 1 night every space was full except for handicapped parking. Notwithstanding the 2 issues we had, it was still a good value for a good quality suite in a good location. While I plan to try something else next time I'm in Vancouver simply for variety, I wouldn't hesitate to recommend the Hampton Inn.

Reviews.Title: “great value, great service”
Reviews.Author: srdavis033
Reviews.Content: The front desk staff was incredible. What a difference from the Sandman that is right beside it. Great location and great value.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great service, would visit again”
Reviews.Author: mollsworth
Reviews.Content: We stayed over for 4 nights and consistently found the service at this hotel to be excellent. The front desk staff are very helpful, and can offer plenty of suggestions about which parts of downtown Vancouver to visit! Renting a bike to zip around Stanley Park was a highlight - even in November!

Reviews.Title: “Indulgent”
Reviews.Author: scottycanoe
Reviews.Content: My first stay at the Hampton-- excellent reception on arrival, marvellous and plentiful fresh food at breakfast, friendly helpful staff who appear to like their jobs. Location cannot be beat in beautiful Vancouver - enjoyed the panoramic view while using the fitness room. Excellent hotel, I will be back.

Reviews.Title: “When I visit Vancouver, this is the hotel to stay at.”
Reviews.Author: bagstrap
Reviews.Content: The service at the Hampton Inn Hotel is great. People are friendly and helpful. Two years ago I stayed with my daughter and we have a wonderful time. So close to everything we were able to walk everywhere. I have stayed this year with my sister, and again we enjoyed the service, the rooms, and the lovely breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic home away from home!”
Reviews.Author: albertamouse
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel several times in the past couple of years and i love it! excellent staff, excellent rooms. very clean and comfy. the breakfast is so tasty, and i really liked the bagged breakfast to go. their shuttle service is very reliable and pleasant. i would rate it a 10 out of 10 for sure. i will be staying there in a few weeks again and am greatly looking forward to it.

Reviews.Title: “my favourite hotel to stay in while in vancouver!”
Reviews.Author: mofoqueezee
Reviews.Content: I love this hotel. I stay here everytime I am in town, about every 4-6 months. The location is great, right on Robson street, the staff is super friendly and helpful, the rooms are amazing and the free breakfast is the icing on the cake! Not your typical continental bagels and coffee, but we're talking pancakes, different cereal, eggs...yum! Would definitely recommend this place to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful first trip to Canada”
Reviews.Author: RoseLizenberg
Reviews.Content: i don't normally bother submitting reviews like this, but your staff was so kind to us and our rooms were IMMACULATE. I'd definitely recommend your hotel to anyone taking a Holiday in the Vancouver area.

Reviews.Title: “Consistently excellent!”
Reviews.Author: eledean
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Hampton Inn in Downtown Vancouver three times over the past three years, and the stay has been excellent every time. The front desk employees are very nice and helpful. Checking in and out is easy and generally very fast. The rooms are large, the beds are comfortable, and the sleeping areas of the hotel are quiet. You would never know that you were in the downtown area of a very large city. The location of the hotel is also excellent and within easy walking distance of almost everything. Also the free internet service worked well although don't plan to use the hotel computer or printer because the charge is $30 per minute! The only negative was the overcrowded breakfast, but that wasn't the fault of the hotel. Considering all of the people, I was amazed at how quickly the staff kept the food replenished and the tables cleaned off. The hotel is a bit pricey for a Hampton Inn, but as someone who made the mistake of trying a different hotel in the area at a lower price, I think this Hampton Inn is worth it, and the price is usually lower in the off season.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable Rooms and Great Service”
Reviews.Author: FootballFan27
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel while attending a Lions game with some friends - and we all really enjoyed our stay. We were able to get into our rooms before 3pm, which was great! The front desk staff was really helpful with restaurants (Keith helped us find a really delicious restaurant in Yaletown), and it was so close to BC Place. The free internet and bottled water were a great touch. I'd definitely stay here again next time I come in for a hockey/football game or a concert.

Reviews.Title: “very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: michele777777
Reviews.Content: Only stayed two nights but it was long enought to see that the hotel staff were very efficient and always happy to point you in the right direction. The rooms were big and airey, with comfortable beds. The food was yummy and we especially liked the new waitress from Nova Scotia. Would return if we w ere in Canada.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing view, staff and room.. who could want more?”
Reviews.Author: Singingsweetie
Reviews.Content: I had planned to stay at the Hampton Inn in Downtown Vancouver with my boyfriend (at the time) to have a romantic stay in the city for the Valentine's day weekend. Not only did the staff treat us both with consistant respect and consideration, they were incredibly helpful and knowledgeable about the city. The front desk staff are exceptional- they made the stay at the Hotel feel like i was in my own home away from home. I highly recommended this hotel to all my friends~ especially the amazing Jacuzzi Tub in the room and comfortable king-sized bed.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: HappyTraveler13_9
Reviews.Content: I had a fantastic stay at this hotel this month! The staff was excellent, service was great! I would recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, Ok Customer Service, Hard to Get Room Before 3pm”
Reviews.Author: FreqTravelers
Reviews.Content: We arrived to Vancouver off a cruise ship. We first arrived at the hotel at 11am and tried to get our room, but it was too early, they said it would be guaranteed by 3pm. There were a lot of people waiting in the lobby. We left our bags and went off to explore. We came back at 2pm and our room still wasn't ready, so we left again. We finally came back about 5pm and was able to check into our room. We found customer service to be just ok. The porter wasn't all that friendly when we left our bags with him, but he did remember our name when we came back. When we checked on our room at 2pm, the front desk didn't really seem helpful. However, the front desk was helpful when helping us with cabs and directions. It took about 5 minutes for them to get us a cab. Our room was on the top floor (15th). You have to have a key with you at all times throughout the hotel. It is required to operate the elevator, get into the ice/vending room, and to get into the lobby bathrooms. I'm sure this is for security reasons, but I went to get ice once without a key and ended up coming back with none after walking up and down 6 floors. There was free wi-fi available, which we used. There is free breakfast from 6 to 10am, although we got up too late our first morning, we did see it our second morning before leaving for the airport. They had coffee, tea, pastries, cereal (all sugar ones), and some hot items (not sure what they were). The top floor has a recreation room with a couple of treadmills, some weights, a ping-pong table, a foosball table, and a huge hot tub. The hot tub wasn't very hot, but warm enough to feel like you were sitting in a bath. The jets weren't very powerful at all either. There was also a balcony area to look out over Vancouver. The location was ok. We were within 15 minute walking distance to the marina in Yaletown and also Chinatown and Gastown. The area of the hotel was pretty safe, it's the areas in between Chinatown and Gastown that can get a little sketchy. The hotel is located along Robson St which is a good shopping street. We've stayed at a lot of Hilton hotels, but I just didn't really feel the hospitality, coziness, or charm here that we normally feel when staying at a Hilton. We usually have great experience with and enjoy staying at the Hampton Inns. Next time we visit Vancouver, I'd probably try to stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “great value”
Reviews.Author: Thelma K
Reviews.Content: I spent ten days in Vancouver to visit a relative, and the hotel was totally adequate to my needs. The roms are spacious and confortable, with a fridge, a microwave and even an iron and an ironing board. The hotel also offers an umbrella (Vancouver is said to be a very rainy place though I only got one day of bad weather during my entire stay) and complimentary bottles of water. Breakfast was also free, and, despite some reviews I saw posted here, I didn't think it was poor or unsavory . It was just simple, but enough to start the day. The staff was nice and helpful, and the chambermaids were simply great. One day my mother forgot a gold ring on the bathroom sink, and no one even touched it! The only aspect that is not so good about the hotel is its location. It stands right in front of BC place, but the area around it is not very nice. I saw beggers on the street almost everyday, and you must walk about five or six block to reach the main shops and restaurants around Robson St. Nonetheless, I must say it is not such a long walk (ten to fifteen minutes) and overall I had a very good time.

Reviews.Title: “Remains my business choice in Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: global-engineer
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here several times over the last three years or so when visiting central Vancouver on business. My recent visit confirms that all the good points I made in my previous reviews are still valid. I highly recommend this hotel for both business and tourist travel, especially if you have a car. But I will point out (as I have in previous reviews), that this is a Hampton Inn, not the Four Seasons or the Mandarin Oriental. Just because it is highest rated in TripAdvisor does not mean that it is the most luxurious hotel in town -- in fact it is not even a luxury hotel. It is a clean, safe, comfortable place to stay. If you are not familiar with the Hampton Inn chain, then check it out before selected this hotel so you will have the correct level of expectation. If you are familiar with Hampton Inn, you will find this to be just as nice, if not nicer, than any Hampton Inn in the USA.

Reviews.Title: “Large apartment, convenient location”
Reviews.Author: Frade
Reviews.Content: We were pleasantly surprised by a number of things. Firstly, it was easy to find. Secondly, our room was much larger than we expected. And thirdly, it is close enough to everything Downtown to be able to walk everywhere (shops, entertainment, restaurants, etc). Free WiFi was a bonus. Many other places only have wired internet. The staff were always friendly and helpful. The restaurant downstairs did a basic room service, and they were very flexible with our special orders. The free breakfast was okay, but nothing amazing. Very basic and the quality was ordinary.

Reviews.Title: “Overrated”
Reviews.Author: AGTraveller
Reviews.Content: The room is spacious and clean, but the furnishing is quite dated, given the room rate. Our reception at the desk was not exactly warm when we arrived on a snowy, quiet day. The location is ideal if you are a hockey fan (as it is right next to the BC Place, the stadium), but not for shoppers even though it is on Robson Street. In fact, the neighborhood struck us as somewhat seedy. The suites do not have a bathroom that opens into the living area, and so if you have more than a couple in the party it is not an ideal situation. There were two computers available in the lobby and you must obtain an access code to use one at 30 minutes at a time. On the days when I stayed there I had to compete each morning with two small small kids who used the computers, in the words of their own parents, to kill time.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely Safe Hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: CDNLynn
Reviews.Content: Our family has just returned from an overnight stay at the Hampton Inn (part of the Hilton brand) in downtown Vancouver. This is probably the 3rd time we have stayed there and have always had a wonderful experience. This time was different though! Our hotel room was right by the elevator and because of distraction, didn't check that our door was properly closed when we left to watch the Canucks play the Senators. We had used the "hockey parent' strategy of leaving the door open with the latch so that our kids could come and go without us having to get up to answer the door...only we left the hotel!! We headed out at 5 pm and returned around 11 pm to find a message on the phone saying that our room had been left unlocked...and to check the room to see if anything was missing. Everything was still in the room...even the laptop. Thank goodness a staff member does a sweep of each floor several times in the evening. As other reviewers have mentioned the hotel is very secure...a room card for swiping is needed to access the rooms by elevator. I appreciated that in the past, but now...even more. The breakfast was great and just what we needed before making the trek back up the Coquihalla highway. I can't say thank you enough to the staff who made our stay complete. They were friendly and kind...and that was before our unlocked door fiasco! As always, the rooms are very clean and immaculate. It is a great hotel that is really close to GM Place and BC Place. It is within walking distance of the downtown core as well. PS. We had 1 room with 2 queens and 1 room with a king bed and paid $143 Cdn each. Parking was $16 per day. I am surprised that it is rated only 2 stars.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and accommodating”
Reviews.Author: biker367
Reviews.Content: Our room was ready at 2 pm when we arrived. The initial room that was given to us was right beside the elevator. Within minutes of us being there someone was leaning on our door waiting for the elevator. A request to change rooms was promptly dealt with. The staff was very courteous and the free buffet in the morning was very generous. The underground parking is the most secure I have found so far in downtown Vancouver. Room key to get in and security cameras. Also keep a room key if you check out before getting your car, you need to swipe the card in the elevator to get to the parking level. There is a key drop box at the parking level. I will stay here when I ride my motortcycle here next summer.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: tweeternc
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel for three nights in Nov 2008. This is a very nice Hampton Inn. Our room was nice and clean and had a microwave and fridge. The staff was very friendly and helpful. They even offered us bigger umbrellas than the ones we had because they saw how soaked we were. The location is great. We only took the car out one time the whole weekend because we were able to walk almost everywhere we wanted to go. They also have a guest laundry facility, which is very handy when you are on a long trip. We are planning to visit Vancouver again in the future and we will definitely be staying at the Hampton Inn.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant city-centre hotel and great value”
Reviews.Author: Stevie390
Reviews.Content: This Hampton Inn is located slightly off-centre, but is still an easy walk from the tourist sights and business district in Vancouver. Several restaurants and convenience stores are located close-by. The worst inconvenience was that the hotel is not on the circuit of the Airport Bus. The hotel is modern with very pleasantly furnished and fully-equipped rooms. The complimentary breakfast had a wide choice, including a daily hot option. The breakfast area, though compact, never seemed overwhelmed. Complimentary internet access was also available. There is a restaurant attached that provides evening meals. The food was okay, but the service was poor and I wouldn't rate it highly.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay in Downtown Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: DisneyParis
Reviews.Content: Dates of Stay-25-26 October 2008 (1 night) in Room #407 We arrived just after noon and were allowed to check in early. We could have stayed on a higher floor had we waited a few hours but since the floor plan was the same, we opted for the best available at that time. Staff went above and beyond-always friendly, smiling, and professional (see comment about safe below). The hotel was directly across the street from BC Place, where the BC Lions CFL team plays, and we were on the side facing it. General Motors Place, where the NHL Vancouver Canucks play, is about 100 metres away. Both teams had home games the night we were there, and there were lots of boisterous fans. There was pre game music and other celebratory noise during and just after the games until about 11 pm, but can’t fault hotel. The fans were well behaved but just loud. If this is an issue, check the game schedules, and stay across town somewhere. The room had 2 very comfortable beds with duvets, 3 large pillows, and 1 small pillow. I got a great night’s sleep. Also, 2 telephones, internet connection in room for dialup but wifi also-didn’t have computer so not sure how well it works (there are two free internet stations on 2nd floor near breakfast room-just ask for 30 minute passwords at front desk), a television with about 50 channels-US and Canadian but no ESPN or ESPN2 so limited US sports, especially NCAA. There was a free in room safe-it didn’t work so I called front desk and someone came in less than 5 minutes to reprogram. There was a refrigerator and microwave but no minibar to rip you off. (there is a convenience store-7/11 I think, just down Robson for drinks and snacks) There was a kettle for coffee and tea and ample supplies-sure they would give more supplies, if requested-2 complimentary bottles of water also! There was a desk, table with 2 chairs, ample lighting, and clock radio. There was a closet with plenty of space and several hangers. The top floor of the hotel has an area with table tennis, 4 exercise machines, pool, dry sauna, hot tub as well as bathrooms and water station-not sure if there is shower in the bathrooms since I didn’t go in there. Terrace for sun bathing or touristy views of city-area very clean and well maintained-no litter or anything negative except smoker on terrace. Realize hotel can’t be everywhere all the time, but warning signs may help. $200 fine for smoking in room, but does that include the terrace or standing in room with head out window-2 windows that opened from room-can see cigarette butts on roof just below room-I wondered if people smoke in room next to window or with their head out window and then use the rooftop for their ashtray. If the hotel is totally smoke free, that should mean “totally”, everywhere!!! (hotel should investigate) Parking area very secure-2 gates to pass through with room key before reaching parking spots. You don’t need key to get out as one previous reviewer mentioned. Parking price reasonable for downtown Vancouver where even meters aren’t free on Sundays and holidays. Elevators require card swipe everytime-even from guest room floors. Felt very safe and secure. Ice machine out of order on my floor but no big issue-hotel had sign and was repairing. I had to go up a few floor for ice. Typical Hampton Inn breakfast-ham patties and fried egg circles the morning we were there plus coffee, tea, juice, breads, cereals, etc. as well-everyday standards at Hampton Inns. I would have preferred sausage patties but no big deal-I just picked the wrong morning for those. If you are meat lover and want a fantastic lunch-head for Samba Brazilian Steakhouse & Churrascaria at 1122 Alberni St (between Robson and Georgia just past Burrard). It’s about a kilometer from the hotel. All you can eat lunch with buffet and servers walking around with different meat skewers for CDN$14, I believe. Lamb is especially good. It’s currently in the Delta Dining guide so I even earned some SkyMiles! I have no complaints except for the lone smoker or two who breaks the rules. This was a great find for a very reasonable price in the centre of a fantastic city. I hope to return to Vancouver in the next few years and will definitely consider staying at this great hotel again. For the price and location, there is no place better!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: taxdoug
Reviews.Content: I booked the hotel because of the positive Tripadviser recommendations. They were fully justified. Really welcoming reception staff, excellent room (following free, unasked for, upgrade). no noise and good breakfast. All for an excellent rate. Downsides - the location isn't great particularly after dark and don't expect too much of a view from your room!

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: LeimomiC
Reviews.Content: we spent 3 nights at this hotel and we were very happy! the free breakfast had a nice selection. there was a great workout room on the roof. we felt very secure and safe because the parking garage required your room key to get in and out. the rooms were very clean and beds were comfy. walking distance to many places to eat, mostly casual places.

Reviews.Title: “Liked the hotel, hated the "private tax"”
Reviews.Author: Crooksmeister
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hampton Inn and Suites Vancouver for 5 nights in the middle of October, 2008. We enjoyed the stay a great deal. The hotel was in excellent shape, despite the fact that it looks to be around 20 years old. Our accommodation was a large, one-bedroom king suite on the 14th floor. It was light, bright and very spacious. The outlook, North-West along Robson Street, wasn’t anything to write home about, but we weren’t there particularly for the view. Everything in the suite was spotless, from the kitchen (equipped with a microwave oven, a dishwasher and a refrigerator, but no stove) through the bedroom and living room to the spacious bathroom. The suite was equipped with two large television sets, and there was adequate lighting for activities during the evenings. The king bed was excellent. There was an adequate supply of high-quality towels and toiletries in the bathroom. The kitchen was fully equipped with cutlery, crockery, microwave cooking dishes and a variety of other implements. Perfect if (like us) you wanted to do a bit of cooking “at home” after a long time on the road. The breakfast (included in the room rate) was OK – standard for the lower-cost establishments in the Hilton range. The high-point for us was that (unlike others at this end of the market) there was real (steel) cutlery and china plates, not plastic. There was an average cold buffet of cereals, juices, fruits and breads, plus the usual “egg-like” and “sausage-like” hot material. We ate at Zachary’s restaurant, in the lower lobby, once while we were there and found it to be quite agreeable. The reception staff were friendly and very helpful. There was adequate free Internet access that was rationed to half an hour/ticket (available from reception), though no-one seemed to mind if you took more than one ticket. The location of the hotel was good for us –a 20 minute walk to the harbour-front, Gas Town and China Town, and less than ten minutes to the restaurant strip in Yaletown and the Robson/Burrard shopping area. There's a skytrain station about 5 minutes walk away. There was a selection of decent takeaway joints on Robson within two blocks of the hotel, and a few bars within the same distance. There’s an excellent IGA Marketplace just three blocks away, and here you can buy almost every (food) thing your heart may desire. And if you can’t suppress the shopping urge, there are Sears and Hudson Bay shopatoriums within three blocks. The hotel runs a free shuttle that will take you most anywhere in downtown (the rule, apparently, is that it will not cross any bridge), including Stanley Park, West Vancouver and so on. For the downside – just one thing. We HATED and REJECT the Destination Marketing Fee (DMF) of 1.5% that’s added to the bill. Provincial sales tax and federal Goods and Services Tax are added to the DMF, so it ends up being significantly more than 1.5%. This bit of lunacy, according to the maniacs at the Vancouver Hotel Destination Association who designed it, is intended to pay for marketing the Vancouver hotels (you can see their laughable rationale at http://www.vanhda.ca/ ). We were at a loss to see why the hotels would expect us to pay for their marketing – one usually expects to see business overheads reflected in the room rate. Paying the DMF is not an option (as it is in Canadian Niagara Falls). You’re stuck with it. We will not stay in downtown Vancouver again while this “private tax” exists (we stayed there 3 times during our latest trip and didn’t think to ask what the DMF was until our final day). We’ll be in Canada again in May, but we will NOT stay in downtown Vancouver. Overall, The Hampton Inn is an excellent place to stay if you have some time in Vancouver and you can stand the rapacity of the Vancouver Hotel Destination Association.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: cps102
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night to go to the Vancouver Snow Show, and had a great time. The room was nicely appointed, and nice big windows with a downtown view. The rooftop gym/hot tub was great, with great big views of downtown and the surrounding hills. The gym also had ping pong, foosball, and a vending machine. The breakfast in the morning, although busy, was just adequate, with pastrys, yogurt, cereal, egg and ham patties, etc. The hotel had an excellent location, right next to BC Stadium, and walking distance to the False Creek Seawall (try Hurricane Grill for dinner...nice location on the seawall). Overall, if I had to stay in the Vancouver area, I wouldn't hesitate to go back here...that's how much I enjoyed it. Many activities in and around the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: wetravelin
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights before our cruise. The Hotel is extremly clean the front desk personel wonderful and very helpful. They provided a shuttle for us to a restaurant and also the cruise ship. We all thought the breakfast was great. We loved the location everything was pretty accessible. This is a city so you need to be as careful here as any other city. I always felt safe and the upstairs was great had some beautiful views. Would stay again no questions about it.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel stay”
Reviews.Author: VisitorBob
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our one night stay at this hotel. We booked two rooms and each was very clean and included a microwave oven and small fridge. The services from the front desk were extremely helpful. The continental BF offered a variety of items and were a step above standard cont. BF offerings. The location was about five easily walked blocks from the central city offerings. Two of the members in our group were in their 80s and a taxi or hotel shuttle was available if it was neeeded. We would agree with other posters that the location was on the edge of the downtown area.The dinner at the next door restaurant was fine.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel not centrally located”
Reviews.Author: Swedish_Traveller
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel because of the good reviews on Tripadvisor. For us on a holiday from Europe it is very hard to understand why this hotel gets so excellent reviews. It is located close to BC Place Stadium but far away from the shops, restaurants and sights in central parts of downtown Vancouver. There is a lot of construction work going on around the area but also besides that this area was far from the Skytrain station and it wasnt always a pleasant walk to get down here from shops and restaurants downtown. The area feels a bit unsafe. The hotel in it self is modern but nothing special a standard average good quality hotel. The room was clean with a normal size and had a standard hotel design look. You get a free morning paper and free wireless internet in the rooms. The worst experience is the breakfast that was included. The service was horrible and the whole situation chaotic with people sitting and standing everywhere. There were too few tables and frequently they run out of food on the buffet specially they had problems with the hot food. There is a nice restaurant connected with the hotel where we had nice dinners that we can recommend. The hotel however is nothing we would recommend for tourists that plan to stay in Vancouver only a few days. Its better to pick a hotel closer to shops, sights and public transport.

Reviews.Title: “excellent”
Reviews.Author: MARILOI
Reviews.Content: Excellent service, location, facilities, rate, and breakfast is included, couldnt been better

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional service!”
Reviews.Author: GatorsFan
Reviews.Content: We arrived early after getting off a cruise. Our room was not quite ready, but the front desk staff made the large fitness area available for us to change. The front desk staff was extremely helpful, even booking us on a hop-on/hop-off bus tour at my request (The Big Red Bus -- don't waste your time and money). We left our bags at the front desk and these were waiting in our room at the end of the day. The suite was extremely clean and comfortable, as was the entire hotel. The front desk arranged a van-cab for us as well. We missed the breakfast, as we left at 5:00 a.m. to catch our flight. I'm sure it was typical Hampton Inn buffet, which usually offers a variety of choices, and, in expensive cities, it beats a $20 breakfast! Location -- at the quiet end of Robson Street, the heart of downtown. We were glad the hotel was not located in the busy section of Robson Street, as it would have been noisy. Great overall expereince!

Reviews.Title: “Good quality hotel”
Reviews.Author: French
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a good quality one in downtown Vancouver. Comfortable rooms, acceptable breakfast (free of charge) and good service. Very useful garage. However no apparent sign of HH level recognition. No bath/shower gel provided: they had a bad quality product and decided to stop providing it! OK but they should provide another one... Quiet hotel: excellent for recovering from jet lag!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, Great service”
Reviews.Author: roadie4
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hampton Inn for 4 nights in August. The hotel itself is located right beside BC place, so the east end of downtown. It's an unassuming building that is situated between Yaletown and Gastown, pretty much. The hotel rooms themselves are good, but seemingly a little dated. Didn't matter to us though. It was a solid room and had everything we needed. Beds are comfortable and it is quiet. The real feature of this hotel is the service. The front desk staff are all outstanding. They deal with so many people every day asking the same questions, and not only do they do it with a smile and are very pleasant to talk to, but they are very organized. Along with little tips and great suggestions that they have, there are also a set documents at the ready of the frequently asked questions (public transit routes and times, maps of the city). From the get-go, they went the extra mile on every request that we had, including organizing transportation to the airport at the ungodly hour of 4am. To a person visiting the city to see the city, this service made the hotel top notch. The breakfast is fine. Don't expect a grand buffet, however, there is the stuff you need to take on the day: Yogurt, cereal, toast, juice, pastries, sometimes sausage, sometimes pancakes. It's nothing special, but nothing bad either. Overall, it's a great place for people who wish to see the city and for families with kids. I would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel”
Reviews.Author: BarbadosMillie
Reviews.Content: From the moment we checked in (on a very busy holiday weekend) we were impressed by the hotel staff. Without exception every member of staff was friendy, helpful and polite. They all smiled, spoke to you in the lifts and remembered details - how refreshing! The front desk staff were very professional and right on the ball. Concierge staff very helpful and advised on buses and attractions. We were given a lovely one bedroom suite on the 6th floor, bright modern, clean, airy and spacious. Small kitchenette contained everything needed for a basic meal. Great as we were travelling with 2 young children (5&7) The breakfast buffet although crowded, was very well staffed and stocked. Items were being replenished right up to the end of the service time and tables were being cleared efficiently. I wish every hotel ran a breakfast buffet like this - no waiting for orders or bills and a good basic selection of breakfast items. We ate one night in Zacharary's downstairs - a very average meal, but nice service. The parking was secure and reasonably priced, internet access fast and easy. The package that we had booked said that movies were included, so when we were charged for a movie I questioned this and it was immediately removed from our bill, although I was very politely told that pay movies were not included. We loved this Hampton Inn and will try to stay with this brand in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: isles_123
Reviews.Content: I spent two pre-cruise nights at his hotel. We had one of our nicest hotel experiences at the Hampton Inn. We booked a King Suite which was very spacious and immaculate. We had a very late check-in after a long lfight and we were in the room within five minutes. Based on all the reviews I read here in making my decision to stay here, I realize there is little that I can add that has not already been mentioned about this location, so I will address just a few things that seem to keep coming up: Service: The front desk staff during out stay and the reservation staff I spoke with pre-stay were beyond helpful. These were some of the nicest people I have ever dealt with relating to a hotel stay. Everyone went above and beyond to give us information. Breakfast: It is not gourmet, but it is extremely generous considering it is free for ALL guests every day of the week. Most hotels that offer breakfast, even for their best customers, do not offer hot items. This, plus the standard pastries and all-day fresh coffee is a huge money saver. Location: This is a big city folks. There will be homeless people. Walk up a few blocks to the coveted "heart of it all" on Robson. There are homeless people there too. There is nothing unsafe about the location of the Hampton Inn. You are within walking distance to Yaletown, Chinatown, the main shopping district on Robson, GM Place and BC Place. We even walked up to the entrance of Stanley Park in less than 30 minutes. There is nothing unsafe about the area; it is just busy. Shuttle Service: Not only may you use the shuttle to get to the cruise pier (no return service) but, if available, the shuttle will take you whereever you want to go Downtown...FOR FREE. Please tip the driver, George; he is very helpful and works hard all day :) I would stay at the Hampton Inn Vancouver - Downtown again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place”
Reviews.Author: Dzonka
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent hotel in an unfortuate position down in the center of Vancuover right beside the football stadium. When there are no games on, it is easy to walk to the center of everything, and the staff of th hotel are excellent at helping you to decide what to do. When the games are on..hmm!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: Yackswife
Reviews.Content: We stayed only one night at the Hampton Inn before our Alaskan cruise and were more than satisfied. The staff was very helpful and the room was clean and comfortable. The breakfast was what we expected after reading reviews but we didn't have a problem with it. We walked around the area during the day and saw a lot of homeless people. I must say that I would not have been comfortable walking after dark. We had dinner at Zachary's, the restaurant adjacent to the lobby and that left something to be desired. They were definitely understaffed for the amount of people that were dining and had to turn people away. There appeared to be only two cooks who seemed to prepare one meal at a time, so if there were a number of people at one table, they didn't get their meals at the same time. I noticed one woman got her food about 20 minutes after everyone else. Some people got upset because of the long wait and walked out. This is definitely not a reflection on the Hampton Inn and I would definite recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Our first trip to Canada”
Reviews.Author: Beeemerr
Reviews.Content: We went to Canada for the first time in June 08. Our first three nights were spent at the downtown Hampton Inn. It was an excellent experience. The staff were friendly and professional, the room spotless, breakfast very good. The biggest bonus was Zachary's restaurant onsite, which was so good we didn't bother to go out to eat at all. The hotel was happy to run us about in their van, and we couldn't have asked for anything more. Would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Pre Cruise Destination”
Reviews.Author: saxmanlee
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel before our Alaskan cruise. No problems at all. The location was not a problem if you can handle walking a few blocks up Robson Street to catch a local bus. The room was a bit small, the bed was a bit firm. Over all, my wife and I hardly stayed in the hotel as we were out and about exploring the Vancouver area. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The breakfast was par, but that is average for Hampton Inn. The internet connection was a bit slow. The room was kept very clean. I don't expect too much from a Hampton Inn, but I know they are usually very reliable. Indeed, this hotel delivered as expected. I read a few complaints about the nearby construction - yes, there is construction work nearby, but it wasn't a problem at night, to loose any sleep over. I also read a few complaints about the homeless nearby, again its a city, you have homeless people in every city. They were not a problem. Check out my rooftop photos from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice”
Reviews.Author: Yetton
Reviews.Content: As I always use Trip Advisor if I am prebooking I only choose hotels / B&B's that review well. Hence my my scores are usually high, suggesting that I am easliy satisfied. That is far from the truth as we like good quality and value for money and thankfully using TA we get that.. We had two nights at this hotel in early June and can see why it so highly rated by TA members. Nothing was too much trouble, check in was excellent, rooms/bathrooms on 4th floor were spacious, very clean, comfortable, welcoming bed linen and secure. Umbrellas were available to use. Breakfast was more than adequate, internet was easy and quick and the views from the 16th floor are stupendous. We ate dinner in the attached restaurant and had a very pleasant meal. I have no problems in recommending this hotel to anyone and will return if we visit Vancouver again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: drewantha
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself is a very nice property and the breakfast is the usually good Hampton fare. The only detractor which really wasn't that bad was the 3-4 block hike to get into the fun part of Robson Street. There is a lot of construction going on in the area so be prepard for a bit of noise during the week. Parking is good, under the hotel but they charge a bit for it. Overall, a good stay.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel for the money”
Reviews.Author: drbsfm
Reviews.Content: Nice location at the end of Robson Street. Short walk to the stores, Gastown and Yaletown. Rooms are comforable and suprisingly quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Great Security”
Reviews.Author: ps5108
Reviews.Content: Stayed two nights here after a trip on The Rocky Mountaineer train from Banff to Vancouver. As part of the train trip, our bags were delivered straight to this hotel and we were taken there free of charge by coach from the station. The check in staff were polite and extemely helpful, a guy called 'Keith' in particular. On arrival, I said that I needed to use a computer to check in with BA 24 hours before my flight. Keith immediately explained to me how I could use the hotel's computer to check in, and print off our boarding passes. I then said that our flight did not leave until late evening on the day we were checking out. Before I could ask about it, Keith informed me we were welcome to leave our cases in the Reception office, that we could use the facilities on the 16th floor before leaving and they would call a cab for us when we asked. Absolutely superb ! On the day of our departure we were hot and tired after cycling round Stanley Park, then walking around Downtown Vancouver. We went up to the 16th floor to find showers, fresh towels and toiletries all free to use. The two nights we spent there were very comfortable, the room was spotlessly clean, well furnished and decorated. One aspect that impressed us was their security system. The swipe card you are given to enter your room is also required to activate the lift and the toilets on the ground floor can only be entered using this card as well. Thereby preventing non-residents from using them, or gaining access to the other floors.

Reviews.Title: “Not you father's Hampton Inn..”
Reviews.Author: IVegas
Reviews.Content: Just came back on a 3 nights/4 days stay at the Hampton Inn on Robson after an Alaskan cruise. Cost about $10 (tip included) to hail cab from the Ballantyne Pier to the Hotel (about 10-15 minutes ride) which is at the East end of Robson. Location wise is not as centrally located as the Blue Horizon which was what I originally planned. Chose Hampton Inn instead because I am a long time HH Honor member and has plenty of points to get free nights except for a weekend night which the points cant be used. Anyway it cost $230 CAD for the entire stay. As for not as centrally located which really is not a problem for us. We've been to Vancouver multiple times and always look at downtown Vancouver like a San Francisco (walking town for us). We can walk from the east end to the west end (to the outskirt of Stanley Park) in half an hour - 45 minutes. Of course not counting time spent going in and out of all the wonderful shops on Robson. We've also walked to Yaletown by the False Creek in 15 minutes, same with going a little north to cover both Chinatown and Gastown. There is bicycle on loan that we took advantage of for 3 hours at a stretch. Recommendation is to get up early (to avoid crowds for both bicycle loan and breakfast bar, or free internet for that matter). We got up around 6:30am, no one at all at the second floor breakfast (which compared to the many other Hamptons that I've stayed in) that has much more extensive menu. Juice, milk, coffee, yogurt, all sorts of breads, pastries, croissant, fresh fruits as well as some eggs and meats. At 8am the doorman came and we checked out the bicycle/helmet and off we go. 3 hours are plenty of time to bike along the entire downtown shoreline including a visit inside the Stanley Park. Getting to Granville Island is convenient on the Aqua Bus. The pier is only about 10 minutes walk behind the BC Stadium. We stayed on the 12 floor, nice size corner room. There were construction around us (2010 Olympics has something to do with the boom in Vancouver) but no noise. Beds were comfortable. Room has the usual Hampton Inn amenities which included microwave, fridge, hairdryer, internet connection. This is not the usual Hampton Inn which stands 16 stories high (top floor is gym/spa/pool) which on the upside gives a great view at the roof top level on BC Place and part of the city. The downside is having only 2 elevators for the entire building make certain time of the day extremely slow service (avoid the usual check in/check out time, the lobby is not big). Staff however are always pleasant and remember your name from start to finish. Courteous and professional and offer help when needed. Hailed cab for us promptly at end of stay and cost $26 + tips to get to Vancouver International in about half hour.

Reviews.Title: “Skeptical at first, then LOVED this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: laleary
Reviews.Content: At first, I was disappointed with the hotel and mad that I hadn't chosen to stay in the downtown Hiton (it had cheaper parking and felt that we would've gotten a King room there ...). We didn't get the King bed like we had requested and I was bummed by the location (at first) because there was construction going on and it didn't seem to be in a good location. Well ... my feelings changed the next morning. The breakfast was very good, considering it was free. Very few hot items, but a sausage patty and muffin later and I had a nice breakfast sandwich! It was a good assortment. The front desk clerks are VERY helpful and friendly. They were more than willing to help us plan our day, even printing information about bike rentals, complete with prices so we didn't have to make those phone calls! They offered to set up the shuttle to take us to a bike rental (which we didn't take because we wanted the freedom of having our car near when we were ready to leave). The next day, we debated if we should take the ferry into Victoria. They again were very helpful in the pros and cons of taking such a long time on a ferry and once again offered to help us with the arrangements. We chose to stay in the city and explore more of Vancouver itself. The hotel is walking distance way from SO MANY THINGS! We walked to Yaletown, Chinatown, Gastown, shops, etc. We walked to dinner everynight and felt pretty safe in doing so. (Just keep your eyes open and be aware!) We noticed the most amount of homeless/beggars around Chinatown, Gastown and the shops on Robson. The room was very nice, and the hot tub on the 15th floor was enjoyable at night (esp. after so much walking!) Complimentary water, small frig and microwave made bringing back leftovers easy and stress-free so we could continue to enjoy the awesome food we had. If you're curious, we found these places to have very tasty food ... Yaletown Brewery ($8.00 pizza on Sundays!) ... try the one with apple - it is really good! La Bodega (Tapas) Banana Leaf (Near Stanley park - by where we rented our bikes) Floata Chinese (Dim Sum) ... if you've never had Dim Sum, probably not the best place to start since we had NO CLUE what we were doing! We had great food, but couldn't understand half of what was being offered to us! After our stay was over, I realized why everyone else had reviewed the Hampton Inn so well - the location is prime, the people are top notch and the city is great! Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Nice room and hotel”
Reviews.Author: HonuNole
Reviews.Content: Nice clean room and good beds (not great) with great bathroom, TV, etc. Good staff, very good complimentary breakfast. Expensive parking in secure lot downstairs, restaurant on-site was ok, but service was non-existent, suggest going elsewhere, numerous choices nearby. Great location if going to stadium next door, otherwise a good distance from Stanley park, the aquarium and many other places. Need to get used to the many one-way streets in Vancouver, otherwise you could go around in circles for awhile.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Aged_Travellers
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 5 night stay at this hotel and would like to recommend it to other travellers. The staff were friendly, extremely helpful and nothing was ever too much trouble for them. We felt we had very good value for money. The hotel is just few blocks away from the centre of Downtown. It looked to be fairly new, so all the decor was in good condition. There was a restaurant attached as well as a coffee bar and gift shop. Breakfast was provided with a varied spread daily. Coffee was available at all times. Our room was light and spacious with a very comfortable bed and pillows. Great views of the city were had from the top floor fitness centre.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: FamilyGuySeattle
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hampton Inn & Suites for two nights right after Christmas. Went to Vancouver to shop the Boxing Day / Week specials and enjoy the city. The hotel is located at the end of Robson Street, right across from the BC Place Stadium. As other reviewers have noted, there are a considerable number of homeless folks in the area, but the same can be said for just about ALL of downtown Vancouver. All od this said, I we were able to easily walk up Robson for shopping, just a block away to the beautiful Vancouver Library, and maybe 10 minutes to the heart of downtown and Canada Place, etc.. Check-in was quick and efficient, and like other reviewers have noted, extremely courtious. We were given a corner room on a higher floor (as requested) with two double beds. The room was clean and clean-smelling when we arived, and the bathroom was well stocked with towels, shampoo, etc.. Nice to have the small fridge and microwave in the room. The wireless high speed internet worked as promised, and was fast. Our room looked down onto Robson Street and to the West. Like I said earlier, the Vancouver Public Library is just up the street, as well as a Starbucks, several good restaurants and a nice grocery store - everything you might want is nearby. We liked the fact that the underground parking was secured (the gate was opened with your room key). The breakfast served each morning has a good selection of hot and cold items - but - the area in which it'[s served is without question too small for the size of the hotel. Each morning that we were there, the room was jammed full, with people standing around waiting for others to finish eating so that they too could sit down. Best to get there early and avoid the rush. The only other thing that was a problem during stay was that the second elevator in the building was "out of order". This left just one elevator working to service all guests, which at times caused a considerable wait. Can the hotel have this fixed? Overall, we enjoyed our stay, and would definitely book there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great accommodation, first class staff, didn't like location”
Reviews.Author: miselemeas
Reviews.Content: From the date of booking to our departure we were treated extremely courteously and efficiently by the staff who were first class. They couldn't have been more helpful, assisting with any queries regarding local facilities, restaurants, transport etc and I can honestly say that I have never met more professional staff in ANY hotel worldwide. We (family of four) stayed for four nights after an Alaskan cruise and chose this hotel because of its No 1 position on Tripadvisor. The accommodation was spotless, absolutely first class. They guarantee that all bedding, including duvets, are cleaned after every use. The bathroom was beautifully clean and we were provided with lovely toiletries. The breakfast was nothing to write home about, however, very basic and some items in short supply. The eating area was quite small for the number of people staying, which meant queuing as most people eat around the same time. However it's included in the price so you can take it or leave it. Don't miss the views from the roof. Its a lovely place to relax with a book if you have time to spare. There's a coin-operated washer and drier for guest use which is very convenient. We couldn't find a stairs on our floor and the elevator seemed to be the only way up or down, except for the fire exit. We didn't feel safe at night walking back to the hotel, due to the number of homeless people which seemed to be proportionately higher in that area than anywhere else. We were never hassled or approached by them but didn't feel comfortable walking at night, so we tended to take a taxi for even a short distance at night. Quite a lot of construction going on in the area. There are a couple of streets nearby which we were advised not to use - Hastings Street is one I remember. All in all a great hotel, with super accommodation and staff.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent for the money!”
Reviews.Author: loves_photos
Reviews.Content: It was our first time to Vancouver, and we had no idea what to expect. The Hampton Inn is a really nice hotel with 16 floors. The gym is on the top floor, and has a fantastic view of the city. There is also a hot tub on the roof (indoors, but with glass walls, so you can view the city). The rooms are well done--modern, but very comfortable, and the beds are so comfortable!! There are newspapers available at the desk (5 or 6 different types). The breakfast is very good--cereals, Belgium waffles, sausage, fresh fruit, yogurt, donuts/muffins--all fresh. A nice feature is the underground parking that is accessible by using your room key. It is well lit and very safe, and the elevator in the garage goes directly to your floor. The elevators will only work if you use your card as well, so the security is very good. The staff was very helpful in directing us towards restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “It is a good place to stay”
Reviews.Author: guy_traveller
Reviews.Content: I"ve stayed in this hotel several times, and it has always been a pleasant experience. The rooms are well set up, and the hotel is well maintained. I like the fact that you can self park and don't have to use valet parking (which so many hotels insist upon). The internet works well, the beds are comfortable, and the bathrooms are nice. It would be nice if the hotel would go "non smoking" and I'm not a big fan of the Hampton Inn breakfasts....at the same time, it is a nice touch to be able to have a free breakfast. I will definitely be staying again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel experience”
Reviews.Author: TravelLib
Reviews.Content: Spent a wonderful evening at the Hampton Inn & Suites in Vancouver. The location is south of the hustle and bustle, but everything that we wanted to do or see was a walkable distance. Great staff at checkin made us feel very welcome. We'd arrived by train and wanted to just leave a bag, but Staci was able to give us a terrific room on the spot. Corner room with jacuzzi, king bed, and windows all around. Very clean and very quiet! Although it was a chilly evening, we did enjoy the view from the rooftop common space. We'd go back in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “Good value, well situated hotel”
Reviews.Author: UkReviewer2007
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hampton Inn in August 2007 and found it to be a really well situated hotel, close to the science museum and the water, right at the bottom (or top!) of Robson Street. The breakfast (which was included in the room rate) was great, a good buffet selection hot and cold. The only down side was if you are in a room next to/close to the lift/elevator - and purely because of people chatting outside your door when waiting for the lift, the hotel staff weere great though when we asked to be moved, it wasn't too much trouble and was sorted out without fuss or hassle. In summary a really decent hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay in Vancouver BC”
Reviews.Author: ilsete
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for three nights with my wife and had a very nice stay. Although this is not a full service hotel like a Hilton or a Marriott, it came pretty close to those brands in most areas. Hotel: Located near the BC Lions football stadium, this hotel is near shopping in an up-and-coming area just out of downtown. Some have noted that places near the hotel can be sketchy. I've been to Vancouver many times and think is and is not the case. If you're from a larger metro area, you'll likely think nothing of it. But, Vancouver is a port city and has some of those port city issues. One is an active drug trade and a lot of homeless drug abusers flock to the city (Canada has pretty limited enforcement). My wife and I were approached by a several homeless drug addicts during this last trip, one within 200 feet of the hotel door. But, the other was within a similar distance to the Four Seasons and the Fairmont so you'll likely get that kind of thing. Anyway, the hotel is nice, although oddly located in terms of accessing the lobby. It was clean, well maintained, and near everything. We used the hot tub (up on the top floor with a deck outside so you can enjoy the view) and the sauna (same location). Both were great; clean, comfortable, and largely ignored by other guests. They serve a free breakfast one flight up and connected to the lobby. Plenty of food: eggs, bacon, sausage, waffles, biscuits, bagels, pastries, fruits. Can be crowded though. All in all, a great addition to the stay. We didn't drive, so can't speak to parking. Its close enough to walk to many downtown locations, and relatively easy to catch a cab. Its not a full service hotel, so there wasn't a real taxi stand, but exiting from the lobby in to the drive we always found a cab there (although I think we waited about 2 minutes once. Room: We had a king non-smoking room. When we arrived, we needed to change our reservation but that was not an issue. The front desk clerk (1 of 2 on duty at the time) was considerate, knew his stuff, and made the change without issue. The room looked out on BC Place. Our second night there the hometeam CFL BC Lions won a game and the cheering spilled out on to the street for about 10 minutes shortly after 11PM. Not loud in the room though, and we thought it was cute that the CFL crowd was so quiet and went home so quickly (not like an NFL game to be sure!). The room had a small sofa, a desk and chair, and the bed. All nicely arranged and in good shape. The room was cleaned daily; adequate towels and supplies left. No complaints. All in all, a very good stay. I go to Vancouver often, and prefer to be near the water. If this isn't a must, or if you can't get a room waterfront in the summer, this is a great choice.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place”
Reviews.Author: dadsasdasd
Reviews.Content: Location could have perhaps been a bit more central for a hotel called “downtown”, but still only 10 min walk to the actual downtown, so no major complaints. Also a SkyTrain station a couple of minutes away. A number of options for eating and drinking close by in the neighborhood (e.g. a couple of grill bars, McDonalds, Starbucks, 7-Eleven etc). Very convenient location for GM Place, for watching Canucks for instance. Breakfast was probably the biggest flaw of the hotel, I certainly wasn’t excepting anything super-luxury like in some five-star Asian hotel, but still the outcome was a failure. Didn’t even bother to take the breakfast at all after two tries… Room was quite large, had two TVs (both traditional models), comfortable bed and a fully functional kitchen. View towards downtown, straight to big construction site next to the hotel. I guess the hotel was fully booked but still it was very very quiet, basically no noise whatsoever in the room. All in all, generally a better hotel than the “corresponding Hilton brand hotel” in Seattle (Homewood Suites) that I was in two weeks earlier. Would I return there? Yes, for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay in Vancouver, very friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: wemarriedinvegas
Reviews.Content: We stayed here because of previous reviews and requested this hotel through our travel agent. We stayed for 3 night but due to Princess Cruises being hopeless, we arrived at 1am. Even arriving at this time the front desk clerk was friendly and willing to give us all the details and more you would expect when checking in. He was even nice enough to remind us of a wake up call should we need it since we had arrived so late and were frazzled after a day of constant disappointment. This hotel is a bit away from the action on Robson Street, but my wife and I found it no problem to walk there even though it maybe a bit much for some (around 3 kilometres, says Google Maps). We also walked to and from Stanley Park which was around the same distance. Breakfast was complimentary and excellent. A great way to start each morning, fresh fruit, coffee (strong, mild, decaf), pastries, hot food, yoghurt. It had something for every taste, if not, you are just too fussy!!! Cab from the airport was $25 plus tip. Well worth it, great place to rest your head and in Vancouver during cruise season was competitively priced. Has a fitness centre with table tennis, sauna, air hockey, hot tub.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: mgsinger
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay at the Hampton. Excellent location. We walked to most places and when we took the car we had easy access to all of the bridges and Highway 1. The staff were very helpful, even printed driving directions for us. There is a sanwich shop on one corner of the building and it has really good sandwiches and soups. Very friendly mom and pop kind of place.

Reviews.Title: “Hampton very good for our purposes”
Reviews.Author: Marilyn42
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hampton for 3 nights - Sept. 14-17 at the end of a 12 day western Canada trip. We were concerned about the location (being on the east side of Vancouver and not downtown) as we returned our rental car, but that was not a problem. Very nice hotel, front desk personnel very helpful. I loved the rooms with the floor to ceiling windows making the room very bright during the day. They have fridge, coffee maker and microwave. It is hard to find accommodation in Vancouver that has smoking rooms, but the Hampton allocate the 4th floor for smokers. We were walking distance to the boat to Granville Island, a casino, a few blocks from Yaletown and a little further to the Tower in Downtown. We planned on taking the Hop on Hop Off Bus, but had covered all we wanted to see except Stanley Park, so decided to just take a taxi as it was a cloudy day. One way fare was around $10.00 - cheaper than paying $33.00 pp for the bus. Plenty of restaurants in the Yaletown district, but can be confusing, even when reading the menus posted outside. We ate across the road from the Hampton - at Players Chophouse -the last night and it was excellent! Service and food were excellent. They were very busy at first, serving the guests going to the Keith Urban concert, but once they cleared out, we were given their undivided attention. We enjoyed not being right downtown in "the thick of things" and found this hotel to be excellent. Take advantage of their hot continental breakfast! Be sure to visit the top floor with the whirlpool and gym, if only to take pictures of the surrounding area.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ann_Ireland
Reviews.Content: This is a lovely hotel in Vancouver. The rooms were lovely and the public areas are very nice. Our room was large with 2 double beds with a fridge and a micro wave. Bottled water was left in the room every day too which is a nice touch. The complimentary breakfast every morning was great with a large selection. There is a small shop along with a restaurant in the hotel. The restaurant closed at 9pm which is a bit early but there are plenty of places to eat around. The hotel is right across the road from the BC Stadium. The is a fitness room with a sauna and jacuzzi on the top floor which was nice but there was never enough towels. The only fault that I can find with this hotel is that it is about 3 or 4 blocks too far down on Robson, I'm not sure I would feel safe walking around on my own. Overall this is a great hotel and I would definitely recommend this hotel. The staff were very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Good Downtown Hotel”
Reviews.Author: mmuggeri
Reviews.Content: We have had 3 good days here in Vancouver. Room very comfortable. Location right at the Bottom of Robson St, quite a bit of building work in neighbourhood (all over Vancouver). The rate I got was quite good for a downtow hotel, and the free BFast helps with the costs. Breakfast typical of free Buffet in this Hotel chain but very adequate. Staff very helpful and provided us with free shuttle to local location.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable value for money”
Reviews.Author: true bleu
Reviews.Content: Location near a run down area .A lot of building work all over central Vancouver. Two bed suite however was of good standard.Clean and comfortable Breakfast was very limited with not enough tables for customers Reception staff very friendly and provided lots of worthwhile info on Vancouver. Lots to see in Vancouver and surrounding areas

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel in vancouver..”
Reviews.Author: BALLYBAY
Reviews.Content: Great location/breakfast/room/staff. The way all hotel should be.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, but beware of BC Place noisy events.”
Reviews.Author: Benzy2
Reviews.Content: Chose this hotel because of it's favorable reviews on TripAdvisor. Was not disappointed until the last night of a 3 night stay. We needed to be up early and were unable to sleep due to heavy, pulsing music and bass coming from BC Place. It did not stop until 2:30am and was loud enough for us to make out some of the lyrics. Our room was on the 15th floor (facing BC Place) which had been great for reduction of street noise, but was no match for the "concert" coming through the closed windows. For value, safety, and location, I will definately stay here again, but I will be checking BC's event schedule to determine whether to ask for a room on the "other" side of the hotel. Our traveling companions had a room on that other side and weren't able to hear any of what we complained about.

Reviews.Title: “Most comfortable bed yet”
Reviews.Author: Adele02
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Hampton Suites for 2 nights at an exorbitant price due to busy long weekend and being unable to find a more moderately priced hotel for 2 nights. It was a very pleasant stay with helpful staff (although they omitted to tell us about the shuttle bus and the fact that there is a booking system to use it). The beds and pillows were the most comfortable we've encountered in any hotel. The breakfast is good although we are horrified at the carbon footprint of Hampton Inns due to their use of syrofoam plates, bowls and cups and plastic cutlery. After a simple breakfast the mound of non-recyclable and non-decomposing garbage is dreadful. It also lowers the standard of an otherwise higher end hotel. The location is a little further away from English Bay and Stanley Park than we'd have liked but if you're unencumbered by young children it is a good walk. No view of the ocean from this hotel either and our room overlooked the rooftops. All in all we really enjoyed staying at the Hampton Suites but would have enjoyed it more if it hadn't cost so much.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MrsSpen
Reviews.Content: Location: Convenient for Downtown (5 - 10 mins) and Yaletown (5 mins - check out the Blue Water restaurant for an excellent meal), close to the Sky Train Terminal and about a 30 minute walk from Stanley Park. The hotel is right next to the BC Stadium, so really easy if you're going to see a BC Lions game. Rooms: Spacious and airy room and good bathroom with bath and overhead shower. The nightlight in the bathroom was a nice touch. It was great to have a fridge tea/coffee making facilities and a microwave. The room was very clean when we arrived and on the second day of our stay; however on our third day it wasn't cleaned or made up, which was a shame as we'd been out for a long day and just wanted to relax when we got in. Breakfast: It's great that this is complimentary and although the breakfast room was busy we always managed to find a table. The selection of cereals and hot food wasn't huge, but we always managed to find something we liked. The one criticism is that for a hotel that in other areas wanted to convey how environmentally friendly it is, it uses polystyrene plates and cups. Service Mixed impressions here - at check in the receptionist was friendly and helpful, but for the rest of the time we didn't get the service we were expecting after reading previous reviews. Nothing serious, just unfriendly, unhelpful staff and a mistake by reception with regard to the taxi to the airport (which they didn't really apologise for). Hopefully the people who served us were just having off-days (it sounds like it since the other reviews have been so glowing). Overall A good value hotel in a convenient location, slightly let down by the service received. I would stay here again, but if it was a special occasion I would probably go for one of the more upmarket hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Great Pre-Cruise Stay”
Reviews.Author: Jazz77
Reviews.Content: We stayed here one night prior to our Alaskan cruise. we took limojet gold from the airport to the hotel and that was great! The Room: We booked a corner, two bed on the top floor and that was superb with fantastic views. The only problem we had was the toilet clogged but nothing big there. Beds were the best hotel beds we slept on ever. Very Very Clean! The Hotel/Breakfast/Facilities The hotel is nice with a cool lobby. the rooftop hot tub/spa we never used, but our kids used the ping pong and fooseball and that kept them entertained. The Elevator on the cruise day (saturday) took at least 5 minutes to get to our floor because of the demand to leave the hotel. The elevator requires key card to use which is good 4 security. The staff is great and very nice and can recommendend great places to eat. Breakfast is better than expected and is good being that it is free. The Cruise shuttle. The hotel offers a free shuttle to the cruise pier and that is great. They take reservations for the shuttle starting at 7 am the day of. IF YOU WANT TO TAKE THE SHUTTLE, BE AT THE FRONT DESK, WAITING IN LINE NO LATER THAN 6:50 OR THE TIMES AVALIABLE ARE AFTER 2. The hotel only has one van, and they should buy more, but still one free one is good.
