We got stuck with the shuttle time at 2:30 p.m when we wanted earlier. we arrived at the pier 2:45 and there was NO LINES at all. TAKE MY ADVICE, BOOK A SHUTTLE AFTER 2 pm FOR BETTER PIER EXPERIENCE. BUY THEN SHIP CABINS WERE READY. The van driver's name is George and he is the coolest.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but not #1”
Reviews.Author: 2teenmom
Reviews.Content: Sorry to disagree with all the glowing reviews, but we had one serious reservation about the Hampton Inn Downtown -- its location. As we drove to the hotel, we noticed dozens of homeless congregating on the streets adjacent to the hotel. The fact that the parking lot had double electronic gates to protect guests strenghtened our feeling that the area was not safe or pleasant, and made us uncomfortable. Also, the view was disappointing -- buildings and rooftops. The elevators are indeed slow, and there is a crush at the breakfast buffet. On the positive side, the room itself was fine, the beds were comfortable (though the pillows were not), and the breakfast was a real bonus. The staff was lovely and helpful. In summary, the hotel was OK, but not what I expected based on TA reviews.

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommend the Hampton Inn & Suites!”
Reviews.Author: MarshaMello
Reviews.Content: My husband, myself and our two teenage sons stayed at the Hampton Inn & Suites for three nights during a pre-Alaska-cruise visit to Vancouver. We couldn't have been more pleased with the hotel staff (who were very friendly and helpful), our room (which was immaculate and spacious) and the location (across the street from BC Place, and within easy walking distance of the Seabus terminal, the Robson St. shopping district, Yaletown and Gastown). As noted by other reviewers, the hotel offers free high speed internet, as well as bikes for exploring the area via its extensive and scenic bike paths. (Normally the "rental" period is two hours, but because no one was waiting for our bikes, we were able to keep them the entire afternoon, and thoroughly enjoyed cruising Stanley Park's seawall.) Booking the free shuttle to the cruise ship terminal on Saturday was not a problem; the hotel even allowed a late checkout so that we wouldn't arrive at Ballantyne too early in the day. My one minor complaint would be the quality of the hot breakfast items, which left something to be desired, but other options (cereals, oatmeal, pastries, fresh fruits, yogurt, etc.) were plentiful, so it wasn't really a problem. During our stay, I must have repeated "I LOVE this hotel!" on at least a twice-daily basis to my family. You can't go wrong with the Hampton Inn & Suites!

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: ChattanoogaMcmom
Reviews.Content: After a week's cruise in Alaska, this hotel was the icing on the cake! The front desk staff was helpful in every way...from directing us to good restaurants and areas in the city to making sure our every need was met. The rooms are spacious and clean, and the beds were wonderful. We liked having a small refrigerator, microwave, and sink in the "kitchen" part of the room, and appreciated the daily complimentary bottles of water. Although we rented a car for the 3 days we were there, the hotel is withing walking distance to many areas of downtown Vancouver. We felt safe (though we saw several panhandlers and vagrants many places in the area), and the hotel is very secure (both in their parking garage and in getting to our floor in the hotel). The continental breakfast was above average, and although there was only one computer with internet access (for a nominal charge), it was easy to use. We have already recommended this hotel to a family member who will be visiting Vancouver soon. It was great!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value, great service”
Reviews.Author: injungun
Reviews.Content: I decided to stay here after seeing the other reviews and I was extremely happy with the stay. My family and I traveled around BC in the last week of June 2007. Though we stayed in more expensive places during our trip, all of us enjoyed our stay at the Hampton Inn. The place was neat and well maintained. The location was good, and the internet connection speed was good as well. The free breakfast provided came with lots of options. To top it all, the front desk personnel were always help providing great service. I would definitely recommend this place.

Reviews.Title: “Just right for overnite”
Reviews.Author: krish2
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our overnite stay at the Hampton Inn before our cruise. Our room was clean and reasonably priced. The beds were extremely comfortable. The view from the top floor was fabulous. The elevator took some getting used to, a little slow. The breakfast buffet was very good. It was convenient to several stores and restaurants. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great base for downtown Vancouver, and beyond”
Reviews.Author: BWUK
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a king suite to start a special holiday in Western Canada. The hotel is nicely presented, with a modern lobby and nice restaurant. The hotel is very close to the harbour and downtown. Ten mins walk to downtown, maybe a half-hour to the harbour. A ten minute taxi ride takes you to Kits beach, Granville Island or Stanley park. The staff are wonderful people, who seem to take a genuine pleasure in helping each guest. We spoke to many reception and waiting staff throughout, who all took the time to get to know us personally. While we were there the staff managed an early morning fire alam very professionally and cheerfully. The room itself was nice, very bright with large windows. The suite consisted of two rooms, including kitchenette and bathroom adjoining the bedroom. Whilst the rooms were pleasant, they weren't amazing. I'm not sure the upgrade to king suite was particularly worth it - but certainly nice all the same. Breakfast was good, and free! A nice selection, but overcrowded at busy times. The friendly staff and good value mean I'd love to visit Vancouver, and this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: FMLW
Reviews.Content: We stayed here after our airline caused us to miss our cruise ship. We were depressed when we got to the Hampton but the staff there were very sympathetic and extremely helpful. The room was great, the breakfast was very nice, certainly enough to eat, and the staff unfailingly courteous and helpful. Mark the Bellman is a font of local information, he can help you with anything. The free shuttle to places like Stanley Park (you have to come back on your own) is also quite welcome. The rest of downtown is a brisk walk away. This will be our number one hotel in Vancouver for future visits.

Reviews.Title: “Well run hotel”
Reviews.Author: Wisconsin84
Reviews.Content: Front desk manager is focused on customer service. Enjoyed the roof top pool and spa. Easy walk to the harbor (about 1/2 hr) Found the breakfast quite extensive. Will stay here again@

Reviews.Title: “Loved the free breakfast! Big money saver”
Reviews.Author: BaileyBlossom
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Vancouver for two nights and found the Hampton Inn Suites clean and convenient. We enjoyed the extra room that the pull out sofa provided. Stuck the two kids there, while we luxuriated in their king size bed. Extremely comfy. The sleeper sofa was a queen, so there was plently of room for both kids, although once they laid on our bed, they did not want to sleep there particularly. The staff was excellent. Breakfast was plentiful. Safe underground parking.

Reviews.Title: “number 1 for a reason”
Reviews.Author: kiwitravellers07
Reviews.Content: we stayed here for 3 nights end of April prior to moving to the Sandman 1 block away to join a tour. we had travelled for 19 hours from NZ via LAX and encountered unfriendly and rude customs agents at both LAX and Vancouver, the taxi driver who drove us from the airport was also not friendly and we were by then very tired and wondering why we had come so far for a holiday when the people were so unfriendly, and then we got to the Hampton Inn and were checked in by Stacey, what can we say, one person managed to turn how we were feeling completely around, she was so friendly, bubbly and helpful, we ran into her a few more times during the time we were there and every time she remembered us and asked if we had done activities that we had mentioned we might do etc. The rest of the staff we saw around the place were always smiling and appeared to enjoy working there. as for the hotel itself, the rooms were bright, light and very clean, the complimentary bottles of water in the fridge were also appreciated. breakfast is included and is above the lobby on a mezzanine level, there is a good selection (cererals, toast, bagels, pastries etc plus a couple of hot dishes) along with juices, coffees. the view from the top floor of the city lights is great also, i didnt use the laundry area but it looked very clean and the machines looked new. location wise was also good, we had no problems finding our way around the city and walked everywhere, the only downside to vancouver is the number of homeless people everywhere, something we are not accustomed to seeing, but we just ignored those who approached us and felt safe enough. I would have no hesitation in recommending the hampton inn, and given the opportunity would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Walking On The Moon”
Reviews.Author: johnnyjumpstart
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for three nights beginning May 27, 2007. I was in town to see the POLICE in concert & wanted a hotel from which I could just walk to the GM Place venue. This was the PERFECT location just across the street. Hotel is definitely 3 stars, maybe more. Rooms are large with wonderful beds. Hotel serves a wonderful breakast in a lovely breakfast area with multiple papers available in the morning to take for free. The Hotel is within walking distance of a local riverfront casino & also the main shopping area of vancouver. Very quiet rooms, Very Clean. Paid $179/night for sat, sun & mon nights. I'd stay here again without hesitation. It's about a 6-7 minute cab ride from the cruiseship terminal too.

Reviews.Title: “The reviews are all true...great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: danoilers
Reviews.Content: First of all, the location is first class. If you're going to GM Place or BC Place Stadium, you're literally a 2 minute walk away. The hotel is also located directly on Robson street so you're a 2 minute walk away from Vancouver's equivalent of Rodeo Drive. For those locations that might take a 10 or 15 minute walk like the Granville Island autobus or Stanley Park, the hotel provides a complimentary shuttle...it goes anywhere downtown. Oh, and the hotel also provides complimentary bike rentals; riding the oceanside bike path's are a must! The hotel itself is wonderful...the rooms, the staff, everything! The rooms are spacious and come with everything you could possibly need (including enough pillows for about 8 people). Wireless internet is included with each room. The room service is reasonably priced, has a good selection and arrives promptly. The breakfast is a very high-end continental. Lots of choices from cereals to pastries to fruits to yogurts to waffles...on and on. You can also get a 'breakfast to go' bag if you're in a hurry in the morning with some fruit, a muffin and a bottle of water. Great idea. Every single staff member I encountered was extremely friendly and in a number of cases they went out of their way to accomodate me. There's also a very convenient web check-in kiosk for the airlines located in the lobby. If you have the chance to stay at this hotel, don't pass it up. It's a steal of a deal at the price.

Reviews.Title: “we loved this hotel”
Reviews.Author: sleepyh
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights on our 2 month round the world honeymoon - we loved it. We got a taxi from the airport which was better than 2 bus journeys (especially with all our bags!) and it was only about $30. The staff in the hotel were excellent, especially Candice who tried her best to get us some ice hockey tickets. Room was very large with lots of nice touches, umbrella, scales, yellow pages. The gym & spa looked great but a bit too high & close to the window for my vertigoed husband We bought new ski/ snowboard gear while we were in Vancouver - all the shops are located slightly out of town around 4th avenue, about 30min walk from our hotel (we got some serious bargains in the sales!) We didn't get hockey tickets in the end so went to sharks sports bar & had a great night

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful gem, just on the edge of everything”
Reviews.Author: klever-weis
Reviews.Content: I have been staying at the Hampton Inn on Robson almost every time I come up to Vancouver. The location is execellent - a few blocks from the shopping on Robson, the restaurants of Yaletown, right next to BC Place. The staff is great, the rooms are spacious and have nice views. The complementary breakfast is fantastic. The gym, while small, has the best views of any hotel gym in the city. The restaurant and cafe are also great.

Reviews.Title: “Almost perfect”
Reviews.Author: MK1England
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my family on vacation. We requested and got rooms opposite each other. Check in staff were really friendly and helpful. We were really impressed with one of the breakfast room staff who remembered where we said we'd be visiting and then asked how we'd enjoyed it a day or so later. The only downside was that on occasion there were more people wanting breakfast than there were available seats and tables. The hotel is well positioned at the end of Robson with central Vancouver within walking distant. Rooms are large and well appointed. Will definitely book here again if we return to Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Lodging Option in Vancouver, BC”
Reviews.Author: West_Linn_Travelers
Reviews.Content: The Hampton Inn & Suites in Downtown Vancouver is unlike any Hampton you're likely to stay at in the US. The property is a 16-story hotel well-located in the central core. I had made my reservation on hilton.com, and paid about C$160/night for a two-room suite on the 15th floor. I stayed for two nights as partof a business trip to Vancouver. Arrival and check-in took perhaps two minutes; the desk agent was friendly and made sure I had my internet access code and a quick run down of the hotel's major services and ammenities. Guests must use their room keys to operate the elevators, a nice security feature. My room was a two-room setup, with a living/room kitchen area with electric range, microwave, and full-size fridge. The living room area has a queen-size sofa bed, a large TV with remote, and a cordless phone. The bedroom had a king-bed with an assortment of pillows (soft/hard), another TV with remote, and a small but adequate work desk with phone and high-speed internet connection (internet is free). The suite was spotless; bedding was crisp and clean. The bathroom was large and well stocked with linens. The bedroom and living room each featured their own HVAC controls, while the bedroom/bath area also featured a control that allows you to control the humidity in the room. I generally do not sleep well in hotels, but at this Hampton I enjoyed a restful, quiet, and altogether enjoyable sleep both nights. The complimentary breakfast is served in a small area that overlooks the small main lobby area. A nice selection of cold and hot items was available. The service and eating areas were extremely clean and well-serviced. All of hotel staff members I met during my stay were friendly and eager to answer questions or offer personal help. An additional complementary service offered by the hotel in the morning is its shuttle service. I used the shuttle to travel from the hotel to the downgtown location where I had meetings scheduled. Not only did I save the cost of a cab, but the driver took the time to point out a number of features of interest. I am a Hilton Diamond HHonors member and over the past 20 years I have stayed at properties from every member of the Hilton family in locations around the world. I can honestly say that the Hampton Downtown Vancouver exceeded my expectations in all respects, whether as to comfort, amenities, value for the rate paid, etc. Whether on business or for a personal/vacation visit, I strongly recommend this property as an option for a stay in Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Loved my stay”
Reviews.Author: lovesports
Reviews.Content: I just stayed there two weeks ago. It was hard not to like this hotel. First, the location is great. You can easily walk to General Motors place for hockey and shopping is also walkable on the same street you're on: Robson. The gym has great views of the city, a weight bench, treadmills, a sauna, ping-pong table and a hot tub. Apples are left there and there are two TVs. The only thing missing was free weights. The breakfast is incredible and included free with your stay. There are cereals, muffins, oatmeal, fruits, tons of beverages and several newspapers you can have. As for parking, it's self-parking, which is better than valet for sure. Also, the lot was safe and you need key access to get in there. It's $16 Canadian daily for the parking, which is very reasonable. The staff was extremely freindly. The room was very nice with a chair and scale in the bathroom. A great experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: DavidHinckley
Reviews.Content: For me and my family this hotel is excellent and every other hotel should try and live up to this standard - if they can. All the staff were really helpful and not just the reception staff but also the cleaners and breakfast staff. The rooms were of a high standard of cleanliness and everything worked. They were also brilliant for a tourist as there was a microwave and lots of other useful equipment. There was also available on the top floor gym equipment, table tennis table and a hot tub. Also nearby were washing machines and driers. For me the best thing was the breakfast, it was excellent, as much food as you could eat. The fresh fruit salad made a great start to the day. What made it particularly good was the price, it really was good value. As someone who has visited many hotels around the world, the package offered here is the best you will ever find. Ps The restaurants in Yaletown are a bit expensive, ask at the reception and they will tell you of others just as close and better value.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed the Hampton”
Reviews.Author: WandererAZ
Reviews.Content: Just returned from Canada. My sister and I spent four nights at this hotel. Room was clean and spacious, contained small refrigerator and microwave plus complimentary coffee/tea. Staff very courteous and accommodating. Breakfasts, which are included, were convenient and hardy, always a hot choice, eggs and sausage one day, waffles and ham the next. Coffee available throughout the day. Location close to transit but also within walking distance to some tourist attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Spa on the 16th”
Reviews.Author: mermaido
Reviews.Content: Stayed with my husband and took advantage of the Romance in the City package. We were very satisfied with the room and package there was only 2 things we were unhappy about. 1st was the fact our in room safe was broken. The hotel staff was very friendly about it and sent someone to fix it but it did not get fix. We were offered to put valuables in the hotel safe instead. The other thing we were unhappy about was the restaurant Zachery's. The food was not that great. We ordered the seafood chowder and it was good but me and my husband ordered steaks and mine though I asked for medium cam out well and was burnt and instead of a server asking near beinginng of the meal if the food was ok only noticed at the end that I was not eating my dinner and only after I reapeated to my husband several times that I was not going to eat it did the server offered to discount the bill. Service in the restaurant needs to be much better. But what we really like about the hotel was the hot tub and game room on the 16th floor. It was very romantic on top of the building. We would defintaly go back to this Hotel

Reviews.Title: “Doesn't quite live up to the hype”
Reviews.Author: ajrduff
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I stayed here for two nights (4-6 March 2007) and although I would recommend the Hampton overall, it is let down by a couple of silly details. The staff are friendly, our room (a King Suite) was big, clean and comfortable and the hotel's location was convenient for us, with plenty of restaurants within easy walking distance. At C$322 for two nights including tax I can't argue with the price, either. Although the room is superbly equipped with tea, coffee, a coffee maker, electric scales, a safe and even an umbrella, there's no kettle. A strange omission - and the staff didn't seem to think it odd that teabags are provided, but without any means of making tea! But my biggest complaint concerns the breakfast. The food itself is good and the coffee is excellent - but I was horrified to find polystyrene plates, plastic cutlery and paper cups. This is just not good enough, and sours an otherwise good service. It would be unacceptable in a cheap motel, let alone in a big downtown hotel. I for one would be happy to pay an extra $5 a night for proper cutlery and crockery - and I can't believe that the energy required to wash it outweighs the environmental cost of landfilling thousands of polystyrene plates a week. Having said that, it is good value. Excellent in some ways, poor in others. Young couples would love it, my parents would hate it.

Reviews.Title: “Not impressed...Sour Experience”
Reviews.Author: CanadianTravellers18
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hampton Inn because of the location and previous positive experiences at other locations. However, we were constantly faced with challenges throughout our one-night stay. We purchased the Romance Package with included sparkling apple cider, $30 gift voucher to the restaurant on-site, and late check out (2pm). When we got to our room, we got sparkling water instead of cider (which my husband hates...so that was pretty useless), then called down to the restaurant for dinner and were told we could not use the voucher because they were busy...what kind of a reason is that, especially since no such condition was published anywhere!? The next day when we went to use it for lunch, and they were closed! Granted, the hotel refunded us the $30, but we had looked forward to a convenient location to eat. After that, we received a phone call at 11am asking us to check out. We had to inform them that we had a late check out. In the meantime, after we got back from lunch they erased our key card, so we had to go back down to the lobby to get a new one. Normally, this wouldn't be a big deal, but honestly, their elevators are the SLOWEST elevators we've ever experienced, and you're not permitted to use the stairs. That being said, the rooms are clean, and the location is great if you're going to BC or GM Place for a concert or game.

Reviews.Title: “Its a Hampton Inn”
Reviews.Author: Mike_the_traveller
Reviews.Content: The title says it all. You get what you pay for. Its a Hampton Inn, the prices are fair, the accomadation is clean, bed is clean, bathroom is clean, and furniture and decor are Hampton inn style. The location is right next to the BC Stadium, which means far away from everything else except the BC Stadium. It is at the very end of Robson St, about 1 mile walk from the main shopping district of town. I'm also a Hilton Honor Gold VIP and did not receive my upgrades, water, complimentary snack, or anything. If you are use to Westin, Sheraton, or Hyatt, this is NOT it or comparable. The amenties are not comparable and the location so-so. But if you are on a budget, this is the right place for you. Clean, cheap, and safe.

Reviews.Title: “Loved breakfast, good wheelchair access”
Reviews.Author: Melissa M
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed here for six nights in May 2006. I'm a wheelchair user and chose the hotel based on price, complimentary continental breakfast, location, excellent detailed information on their website regarding wheelchair accessibility and the ability to check accessible room availability and book such rooms directly online. Other (especially Australian) hotels take note - the ability to check availability of accessible rooms and book these directly via hotel online booking systems is a real selling point for me, and probably other wheelchair users. It saves a lot of time and effort, and says a lot about a property's willingness to treat wheelchair users as real customers. The hotel facilities did not disappoint at all. The room accessibility was good (no roll-in shower though), fantastically comfortable bed (for which we were very grateful after *long* flights from Australia) and a kitchenette with sink, microwave and plates, glasses and cutlery. Accessible train transport was an easy two blocks away. The location for us was a minor disappointment. Although the hotel is located in Robson Street, there were not many restaurants or cafes in the immediate vicinity, although there is an onsite restaurant. Room service hours were limited too. Nevertheless, complimentary continental breakfasts and coffee in the lobby made up for this minor disappointment, and as mentioned above, transport was a breeze. Given the length of our stay, we really appreciated also the hotel's laundry for guests and its panoramic views of Vancouver from the top floor. Overall, a great experience and a hotel recommended for a Vancouver stay.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed hotel but far from shopping/dining on Robson”
Reviews.Author: jdrblue
Reviews.Content: My family of three (2 adults, 1 six yr old) stayed here Dec 27-29. The room was comfortable--down comforters, choice of soft/firm pillows, bottled water, clean bathrooms, free internet connection, free decent breakfast and secure ($14/day) parking. Be sure to ask for a room away from the elevators (noisy guests) and a city view--we had an up-close view of the stadium. I suppose we could have requested a different room but it was not a big deal. The only major drawback of this hotel is the location. It is at the very end of Robson Street, where there is no activity taking place except for a few homeless people mulling about. That made things a little sketchy at night. The hotel does everything to make you feel secure as you need your key card for practically everything. Still,we walked to Robson in the morning but took cabs back in the evening. The main shopping and dining areas are too far to walk roundtrip in the winter with a child. Perhaps ok for a couple. Nevertheless, it might make sense to stay in this comfortable hotel and save money, and then spend $5-7 dollars (one way) on a taxi for transportation to Robson. Good location if you have a car and want to visit Granville, Space Center, Vancouver Aquarium. (Side note: Driving around Vancouver is like driving around NYC.)

Reviews.Title: “Amazing value!”
Reviews.Author: rocks009
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel for 2 reasons: in-room hot tubs and the great reviews on TripAdvisor. Although I was doubtful that a 3 star hotel could really be superior to other fancy 5 star hotels in town, it was the only hotel we could find with in-room jacuzzis. We loved the place! Our room was a Deluxe King Jacuzzi room located on a corner with full windows looking out over BC Place and the Cambie St Bridge. It was a very nice room, with an extremely comfy bed and nice fittings. The jacuzzi was fantastic and a great size for two. We payed for a Romance package (C$199) for one night, which included a box of chocolates, some non-alcoholic sparkling cider, a $30 voucher for dinner in the hotel's restaurant, and most importantly a 2pm check-out. At a premium over the standard room rate of $159, the package may not be worth the extra cost. With so many amazing restaurants nearby in Yaletown, the hotel restaurant is an unappealing option and we didn't use the voucher (although it might be able to be used for breakfast?). The chocolates were tasty, but the 2pm checkout was excellent and almost made the package deal worthwhile on its own. The standard room rates all seem to include a continental buffet breakfast: standard fare with juices, coffee, pastries, cereals, fruit, yogurt, but with bonus scrambled eggs and breakfast sausage patties. Nothing fancy and a bit wasteful with disposable plates and cutlery. This place definitely deserves its #1 popularity rating on Trip Advisor. Although it is down at the quiet end of Robson Street, it is only a short (4 blocks) walk from all the superb nightlife, restaurants, cafes and shops in Yaletown. The money you save on the room can easily be spent on a high class night out.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value, Good for Stadium Events”
Reviews.Author: Kahbah
Reviews.Content: I took my husband to the Avs/Canucks game for a birthday weekend in Vancouver. This hotel couldn't have been located better - the walk to and from GM Place took 5 minutes. Additionally, we did a little shopping on Robson Street, which was only a few blocks away. The location was great - it was downtown, but it was really quick to get out of downtown too. It's true the hotel is not immediately surrounded by lots of pretty buildings, but it was hard to beat the view once you got up to your room. I booked a Jacuzzi suite which was clean and beautiful. We had a corner room, so we had views of two directions as both outside walls were nothing but windows. The king bed had nice linens, though we found it a bit hard for our tastes (we like really soft beds, though). Housekeeping left us alone to sleep in and just relax in our larger-than-average room. We enjoyed the jacuzzi, which was roomy enough for tall (6'5") folks, though the jets were really loud (not uncommon). There is a lack of breakfast places nearby, so we ate a late breakfast in the restaurant and were immediately taken care of and served a good meal. Was it the best hotel room I've stayed in? No. Was it a better-than-average room, for a good value in a downtown location in an increasingly expensive city? Yes. If you are expecting boutique, original design or to bathe in luxury, forget it - this is not Hilton's luxury chain. But it's a better-than-average chain hotel (with free WiFi, no less) and sometimes that's just fine. Oh, I forgot to mention the free bottled water, replaced daily. I can't recall the last time I stayed in a hotel outside of Mexico (and often one much more luxurious), and wasn't charged some ridiculous rate for water. I realize it's just water, but when you get to your room after dinner or a few drinks, it's nice to have a free bottle there.

Reviews.Title: “This cannot be the top rated hotel in Vancouver!!!”
Reviews.Author: juju1967
Reviews.Content: I booked a three night stay at the Hampton Inn in Vancouver at the end of November based on the incredible reviews from Tripadvisor.com. The Hampton Inn is a nice budget hotel. The location is NOT fabulous in my opinion. It is at the very end of Robson Street and not really next to anything other than the Stadium (which is directly across the street.) Really I was depressed when my taxi pulled up to it. On my flight I met a woman who works for the Tourism Department in Vancouver. She was stunned that Tripadvisor had rated Hamton Inn as the # 1 hotel in Vancouver and EMBARASSED!! Certainly you can walk to shops and restaurants from the hotel-but nothing cute or charming is within eyesight. The Opus Hotel (which ranks # 5 by Tripadvisor.com) by comparison is in a cool, unique neighborhood surrounded by great restaurants and shops. However, the Opus Hotel is directly next to a large and noisy construction project. The beds were very comfortable at the Hampton Inn and we had no complaints in that department. The breakfasts were not great nor was the staff very friendly. Vancouver is a beautiful city that is very unique. The Hampton Inn is great if you are on a budget, however has a very motelish feeling to it. This is not a hotel I would reccommend to someone other than for price as it is cheap. It is definitely not upscale or luxurious and frankly neither are the clientele!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Staff”
Reviews.Author: ralph55
Reviews.Content: This hotel is on a very popular street with restaurants and boutiques. The hotel staff was very helpful helping us to get places using their shuttle or taxis or explaining the sky tram. They made us feel quite at home. The room was very clean and comfortable with down comforters. A bonus was the complementary buffet style breakfast, not just the usual toast and oatmeal. The aquarium is great with families as is Stanley Park. We checked out the huge 500 store mall, but one store started to look like all the others and the only main restaurant was TGI Fridays. Our biggest regret was being across the street from the hockey stadium and not taking in a game. Lots of opportunities for $40 seats.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: Bfords
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed here on holiday with our two young children. The hotel is in a good location, approx 8min walk from all the main attractions and shopping on Robson street. The hotel offers excellent value for money, so good we checked with the reception as we could not believe how cheap it was! The room was cleaned to a really high standard and the beds really comfy, the room was situated on the 14th floor and we had views of the BC place (football/event stadium). There was a football match on that night and music could be heard but this all finished at around 22.00. The breakfast was really very good and included in the price of the room, the choice changed daily. The jacuzzi on the 16th floor had really good views of the city, the fitness and sauna area was clean and well equipped. Reception offered a free courtesy bus ride anywhere in downtown, we went to the aquarium, not to be missed!!

Reviews.Title: “The Hampton Inn Rocks! Everything was excellent-The room & The STAFF!”
Reviews.Author: Whooligan
Reviews.Content: This hotel is worthy of all of the praise. We had a large group of Who-> Fans book this hotel based on the reviews here. Three of us shared a huge suite, one bedroom-two qn beds with a sitting room & kitchen. The location is esp excellent for events at BC Place & GM Place. Easy walking distance for many of the downtown tourist sites. The rooftop spa and workout room were great. The breakfast was substantial, including eggs. On top of it all the staff were wonderfully helpful with every need. All 12 of us a had a great experience.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Service!”
Reviews.Author: akwablu
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hampton Inn & Suites for 3 nights and we have to say that the service was exceptional. The staff went out of their way to make sure we were comfortable and that all was well with our room. They were sold out of non-smoking rooms but quickly accomodated us to one as soon as it was available. Their breakfast was good and they had good Wi-Fi service available with access codes for us to use. The room was clean and had a great view of Robson street. The staff recommended the best tours of Vancouver and the tour guide was very friendly and humorous and had an opinion on everything which made for a great 4 hours of sightseeing. They even recommended places that we could take our kids to which would make their visit to Vancouver just as memorable. Exceptional hotel, fantastic price!

Reviews.Title: “Overall Best Quality-great long term stay”
Reviews.Author: flyin321
Reviews.Content: We brought in group of 20+ people for filming in the city, all checking in different dates and time, and the front desk handled everyone's check-in smoothly and with NO MISTAKE! Even Smoking/Non Smoking request and credit card authorization was taken care of prior to our arrival. With my experience with other high-ranking hotels, this was never done so well before! Great Job Hampton VAC! We were all satisfied with service, room, breakfast, amenities, etc. Most of us stayed in this hotel for about 3 weeks, and everyone felt like home coming back every night. Room amenities are well thought of. Each rooms were equipped with frig, microwave, free bottles of water, umbrella for rainy day outing, and a scale to keep us in shape! Not to forget free high speed internet everywhere in the premise. Lovely experience here. We'd love to be back!

Reviews.Title: “Great Value!”
Reviews.Author: rosrey
Reviews.Content: Besides the facilities and location, I look for overall value when booking a hotel and The Hampton Inn exceeded all my expectations. We slept very well for 4 nights: the black out curtains were very effective, the mattress was firm, the bedsheets were soft and the down comforter with the white coverlett was cloudy soft goodness. Overall, the complimentary continental breakfast was very good and I was particularly happy with the quality of the fresh fruit and coffee. There were also some other thoughtful complimentary amenities such as a two hour bike rental, gym with jacuzzi and sauna, bottled water, in room safe and in room high speed internet. However, there's a fee for the underground gated parking which came to about US $14/day. Since it's located at the end of Robson street (close to the library and BC place stadium) it's about a 10 min walk to Yaletown and the center of downtown. Although it's not a shi-shi 5 star hotel, I appreciate the non-shi-shi prices and I doubt I could have been more comfortable. Thanks Tripadvisor! Tip: the highlight of our trip was the bike ride around Stanley Park and the amazing food scene (for the foodies out there you have got to try La Bodega for some excellent Spanish tapas!)

Reviews.Title: “Loved It!”
Reviews.Author: stasho1
Reviews.Content: Great stay!! Excellent attentive staff who came to our rescue twice in 15 minutes. Once the bathroom light was flickering and neede changing and the TV wouldn't change channels. Both times we got fast friendly service. As always at the Hampton Inn, the bed was amazing, the room was clean and the breakfast perfect.

Reviews.Title: “A great base for visiting Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: champagne traveller
Reviews.Content: Located in the heart of the downtown distrct, the Hampton Inn and Suites is a 1st class base when visiting Vancouver. We stayed in a 1 bedroom suite for 3 nights in July and although we booked for room only, the first pleasant surprise was the complimentary breakfast. Add to this the free cycle hire, free shuttle bus (which you can book to take you anywhere you want to go in the city, whenever it's available) and amazingly firendly and helpful staff, you can easily see that we couldn't recommend this hotel any higher. The large top floor (indoor) hot tub with views of Vancouver was a welcome place to chill after a long day's sightseeing! Don't go anywhere else - you really don't have to.

Reviews.Title: “Starting off on the right foot...”
Reviews.Author: SOFTWARECONSULTANT
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel on the first night based on all the great reviews on Tripadvisor. The reviews were accurate, this hotel was fabulous. Can't say enough about their front desk service, very helpful and pleasant. The pillows was best among the hotels we stayed during our trip. Complimentary hot & cold breakfast was added bonus. The location was alright, lower end of Robson street, which presented less traffic. Overall, the stay was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel !!Lots to Do in Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: steadyhand98
Reviews.Content: I am sure you can stay in a fancier place but this hotel lives up to its rave reviews ..Excellent staff ..great modern clean rooms and a convenient location..Nice roof top patio with minimal gym, ping pong table, washer dryer..No need for a car..Free bikes provided for 2 hours(reserve them early) so you can take a beautful bike ride along the water to can't miss Stanley park.. A day trip to Grouse mountain is a must do if you like spectacular views and there is a nice restaurant at the top of the mountain overlooking the city...We skipped the hokey log rolling show they do there but young kids seemed to enjoy it..There is a great observation deck not too far from the Hampden Hotel located in another hotel called Harbor Place..The restaraunt isn't that great so just do the obervation deck (about $11 each I think..) Night views are spectacular..."Canada Place" is another interesting area and is where the cruise ships dock along with the seaplanes..They have a world class hotel there you can walkaround with places to eat and an Imax...Try the "Boathouse " outdoor deck for lunch near the entrance to Stanley Park..Decent food and good waterviews..Use your ATM card to get money instead of exchanging money at the airport..The $200 I took out in Canadian money ended up being somewhere around $175 American money with a $1.75 ATM fee..Save your receipts for everything ..Some taxes are refundable..Bring a light jacket and or sweater and rain gear although it was perfect when we were there in mid August

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: miltonmao
Reviews.Content: My wife and I travel extensively usually staying at 4 to 5 star hotels.I'm hard to please but we were very happy here, everything was new and clean,the staff were courteous andefficient.The breakfast wasn't elaborate but very satisfying.Free wifi in the lobby and I loved the breakfast bags to go at the front desk.My only minor gripe is the room we had was next to the elevator,and we were disturbed by guests speaking loudly while waiting for the lifts.Perhaps a sign near the lift could help?I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommend The Hampton”
Reviews.Author: Toopsie
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent last weekend at the Hampton and couldn't have been happier. On Friday night, our plane landed at 11:30, so by the time we got through customs, collected our bags and took a taxi to the hotel, it was after one in the morning. The staff was wonderful; polite, helpful and totally welcoming which surprised me, considering the hour. When we got up to our room, we saw the lights had been left on for us. It was a nice touch. The room itself was honestly the cleanest hotel room we've ever been in. This is extremely high praise, since I'm notoriously picky about cleanliness. (You could say I'm anal-retentive but I prefer to say I have high standards.) Even the toiletries in the bathroom and the condiments by the coffee maker were laid out in perfectly neat rows. I thought I'd died and gone to neat-freak heaven. The bed was wonderful, with a fluffy down comforter, soft cotton sheets and a mattress so nice, my husband woke up the next morning without the backache he usually gets when we travel. In the morning, we used the workout room on the top floor of the hotel. Again, it was perfectly clean and boasted a fabulous view of the city. After running on the treadmills, we stretched out on the large, wrap-around deck area. With the beautiful view and the cool breeze, it was the perfect way to end our run. On our way out of the workout room, we noticed a large basket full of fresh apples (we each grabbed one and they were delicious) and stacks of cups next to the water fountain. For me, that kind of thoughtfulness and attention to detail sums up the Hampton. We normally would never stay in anything below a four star hotel. Originally, we were going to stay at the Opus, which I'm sure is a fine hotel but before we booked anything, we consulted the reviews on this site. After reading the overwhelmingly positive comments, we thought we'd take a chance. We were not disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “love the Hampton inn & suite”
Reviews.Author: melofun
Reviews.Content: We are a party of 7 all adult, we like the hotel and the people at the hotel, they always ready to help. we have two suite, one next to the other one, all our requirement were meet. We request the two suite been closed also we want a roller bed in one of the suite, and when we arrived the roller bed where there. Also the people on the reception were very nice and always help with map and directions. The hotel is very closed to downtown, plus they have a shuttle, the one we used twice, the bed was very confortable and the breakfast very good and was included. If we come back to Vancouver we will go to Hampton inn & suite, Eden was our cleaning lady, she was very nice, even she have to be nervious about her wedding, she always meet all our requirement, specially we need a small pillow, and she bring to us. Thank you to everybody at hampton Inn Mercedes Cabrera Chino Hills Ca

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Hampton”
Reviews.Author: Aussie08
Reviews.Content: We stayed at theHampton Inn for three nights in early July. Firstly the staff are EXCELLENT. Nothing is too much trouble. From checkin to check out they were very efficient and helpful. The continental breakfast is one of the best we encountered in the entire five weeks of our vacation. There is a guest laundry. We had free self park on the premises in a locked underground garage. The beds are extremly comfortable the rooms well appointed with fridge and safe. We chose to walk downtown and it was only about four blocks to the main part of downtown. We would defintiely return to the Hampton.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice”
Reviews.Author: rightboy
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hampton Inn and Suites post Alaska cruise and found the hotel to be well maintained, efficiently run and a good choice to make in Vancouver. The hotel is at the end of Robson Street and is about a 6 block walk to the shopping district. Yaletown is about 4 blocks away and is also an easy walk. The bed is our room was heavenly -- very comfortable and apparently new. The rooms are very good size with all the regular Hampton Inn features. The lobby of the hotel is minimal and the breakfast area appears to be somewhat small and crowded for the size of the property. There are also only two elevators for this 16 story hotel, so waits can be lengthy. This is the first Hampton that we have experienced that did not provide free internet service on the hotel lobby computer. There is a $4.00 per 20 minute fee charged for their computer, but no charge for the wireless service if you have your own. Vancouver is a city of contrasts -- beautiful scenery, great shopping and restaurants and many wonderful things to see and do. With that said, Vancouver has a more visable homeless population than almost any city we have visited. We were approached many times during our walks by people asking for handouts. It's so sad to see so many people sleeping on sidewalks and lining up for handouts. One needs to be careful where one walks, both day and night, in this city. The Hampton Inn is a good choice to make, at a reasonable cost, while visiting Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: flyqueen
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently stayed at the Hampton during a vacation to Vancouver and Victoria. We returned to the hotel after a brief stay in Victoria, so we had the chance to sample the deluxe king room with jacuzzi during the first part of our visit and the standard room with double beds upon our return. We both agreed that the standard room was superior given the view and the sense that the room was larger. The beds were very comfy, the rooms and hotel were clean and bright, and the location of the hotel was perfectly nestled near trendy Yaletown, where there are many fine restaurants and boutiques. The continental breakfast was a nice perk, with coffee, eggs, sausage, fruit, and various pastries. There is a fee to use the one computer at the hotel, and don't count on the free shuttle service because every time we requested to use it, we were told they were booked up. Apparently, several hotels use that one shuttle, so you will need to book it well in advance. This is not a fancy hotel, but a great one for the cost, location, and overall service. We absolutely loved Vancouver! It's a modern, lively, and fun city. And the people are so friendly!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel for Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: SLin96
Reviews.Content: We absolutely loved this hotel. It was more than we expected. I had booked on the basis of the great reviews on tripadvisor and everything they say is true...we were able to check in early (I realize that not everyone will be able to) and the reception was cheerful and helpful...she even told us if we were hurried we could still catch breakfast! Excellent continental breakfast - a couple hot items such as scrambled eggs, sausages...all kinds of cereals, wide variety of baked goods, free papers at the breakfast area, room clean and very inviting...a wonderful hotel....free shuttle to the cruise terminal (have to book), great location near downtown...can't say enough about the friendliness of this place.

Reviews.Title: “Go for it!”
Reviews.Author: Jimforever
Reviews.Content: This hotel is such a breath of fresh air. It's not grand luxury, but very comfortable and attention has been paid to every detail from the night light in the bathroom to the choice of pillows. Excellent free breakfast too. Only minor quibbles would be the limited choice of TV channels and the lack of internet facilities for anyone who's not wireless. Would definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “A little bit of luxury”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Decided to stay at Hampton Inn after reading 20+ recommendations on Trip Advisor and was not disappointed. AFter spending 1 week in Whistler mountain biking we wanted our 2nd week in Vancouver to be relaxing. What swung it for us was the fact we could have a kitchen and living area so could save a little money if we needed to by cooking in and have more room to chill out in then a standard hotel room. We opted for the 1 bed king suite which was booked through the hotel website - this seemed to offer the same rates as any of the online agents. The room itself was spotlessly clean with an enormous and the most comforable bed we have ever slept in. If you can remember to take your laptop as you get free internet access in your rooms. I can not praise enough the housekeeping staff, we left written requests in the room for extra complimentaty items such as bottled water and tea and this was always noted, also our first day we realised that our floor (10th) was not serviced till quite late on in the day but after talking with the housekeeper they moved us to a time that suited us better for the rest of our stay. The only downsides to the hotel were; check in staff not overly friendly and do not volunteer inforamation i.e. there is a complimnetary shuttle bus which takes you downtown but this is not in the hotel guide book in your room and check in did not mention it; breakfast is served daily between 6 and 10 am but there is limited seating so ask check in when the best time to go or if you have a suite take the food back to your room and cook it there; the hotel is at the very end of RObson Street, so ladies take your trainers - I didn't wear heals once!!! If I can I would also like to recommed the Vancouver Whale Watch Company- we booked a day out with them and arranged for the pick up facility - we happened to be in Zone One which is right opposite the hotels front door which made a fantastic day out even better : ) All in all a great end to our first visit to Canada.

Reviews.Title: “This one will exceed your expectations”
Reviews.Author: jcniii
Reviews.Content: While not in the center of Vancouver this hotel is great...especially the staff. I've never stayed anywhere(and god knows I have) where the staff were more helpful and knowledgeable. Rooms and bathroom are niced sized and have A/C and of course heat. The hotel is at the very end of Robson near the Vancouver Stadium but catching cabs and transportation are easy. Their shuttle will even take you to most places for free!!! Beware of Zachary's the bar/restaurant in the hotel..a few drinks will run you broke as I discovered...$7-$8can per drink can add up fast and food is mediocre at best. Overall this is one of the best hotel's Ive stayed in for the money...but if there on Saturday morning everyone and their brother is there to catch a cruise to Alaska so be aware that you might have to wait awhile for the elevator.

Reviews.Title: “A good choice”
Reviews.Author: Sooz2
Reviews.Content: I'm glad we stayed at the Hampton for 4 nights, and the things that really matter to us were good: very comfortable beds, very quiet, very clean, and everything in good condition ... things like that. It's actually an amazingly good location, although not perfect. The breakfast offered the BEST fresh fruit of our trip although not much else that we are crazy about, but NICE. The little things that are not special are the very modest lobby, the usual Hampton Inn plastic cups... As someone else mentioned, it's within walking distance of "Yaletown" and wonderful restaurants. We thoroughly enjoyed "The Cactus Club." We would definitely pick this hotel again, unless something even better opens up!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for US!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Spent one night prior to cruise. Deluxe room with Jacuzzi was exactly what we needed after flying, very comfortable corner room and the bed was PERFECT. Staff couldn't be nicer, complimentary shuttle was an added bonus. Only downside would be the area, would not want to walk around at night, however had no problems doing so during the day. Would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Happy with Hampton”
Reviews.Author: Cruzer2
Reviews.Content: We stayed post-cruise for two nights in a king bed jacuzzi tub corner room (eighth floor). Strong Points: Bed was outstanding with quality duvet/linens. Very comfortable and clean. Room was extremely clean and well-maintained Very quiet, even though it was a full house Good view - not fantastic Ideal for stadium visits and cruise port Reasonable location if you enjoy walking Full buffet breakfast Small gym on the rooftop terrace - about three pieces of equipment Jacuzzi tub was large, mmaculate, and totally functional Free shuttle to downtown areas Weaker Points: Not as centrally located as I'd originally thought, but not enough to be a deterrent to staying here again - plus, they have a shuttle Lobby and overall look of hotel is so-so, but you aren't staying in the lobby Breakfast was a zoo...too small of an eating area Crowded and noisy in public areas The steakhouse directly across the street was fantastic and reasonable (for nice dining). Best sweet and sour chicken anyone of us (group of four) had ever had was at Mitzi's in Chinatown. We went back again, and ordered more dishes - delicious Chinese food. There was a cafe on the corner in Gastown called Waterside, or something like that - also excellent. The food is super in this city. People are friendly and helpful. There is a lot of panhandling and drug addiction, however. Talked to locals about this at length. Try a double-decker hop on and off bus to get a good overall sightseeing tour. The pick-up spot is around the corner from the hotel. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Miles above the typical Hampton”
Reviews.Author: Trav0042
Reviews.Content: This is not your typical Hampton Inn. The front desk staff was knowledgable, and they spent about half the time helping guests with directions & recommendations. At breakfast, they offered no fewer than 3 daily newspapers, which was quite unexpected. An AMAZING view from the rooftop health club (the health club was on par with the average Marriott) with rooftop patio seating. There was an onsite laundry also on the top floor. VERY comfortable beds. The hotel even has an onsite restaurant (above average food with below average service). It is located quite a ways from Stanley Park, but they offer a shuttle and city buses are convenient.

Reviews.Title: “not as good as I'd hoped”
Reviews.Author: CatherineRice
Reviews.Content: The disappointing thing about this hotel was the fact that I was so led by the rave reviews on this site that I cancelled my reservation with the Granville Island Hotel & booked this one, which was more expensive and not as nice a location. It was an ok hotel, but nothing amazing. The room was nice but the view looked out onto a car park, and the sauna was out of order. The breakfasts were exactly the same every day of the week apart from one, and the hotel is 5 minutes walk near a really run-down part of town, although this can be easily avoided & you wouldn't know unless you were to venture into this area as there are no panhandlers around the hotel area. However, it was near Yaletown which has some great restaurants. The hotel also provide a really useful shuttlebus which is a great service. The beds were extremely comfortable & the maid service was excellent. The check in service wasn't great as the man on reception kept answering the phone whilst he was dealing with us, something I would have got into big trouble in my time when I was a hotel receptionist, but i guess they were extremely busy & he probably had no choice. I was also disappointed that days after I'd booked the hotel I found that they were running a cheaper rate for the same room. I would recommend it for a shorter stay, and also it would be very good value for families, but I guess I was just so disappointed it didn't live up to all the claims on the website and wished I'd never read them & had stuck with my previous booking, as this was supposed to be the trip of a lifetime and I ended up with a view of a parking lot.

Reviews.Title: “Decent place for pre-cruise hotel”
Reviews.Author: sagacioustraveler
Reviews.Content: We chose the Hampton Inn based on other reviews and price for a downtown Vancouver hotel for the night prior to our cruise. Room was good sized with mircrowave, sink, dishes, corkscrew (!) wine glasses, etc. Bed comfy. Nice amenities. Quiet. They didn't give us a requested higher floor so view from our 6th floor was minimal. Regardless, they have a lovely rooftop terrace (and jacquzzi) where we brought up a bottle of wine and enjoyed what views they did have to offer. Not exacly in a bustling part of town (which made location quieter)yet it was walking distance from the Marina and Gastown. And yes, careful of where you walk after dark - neighborhood can get dicey. This is, I'm sure, why you need a room key to operate the elevator. Breakfast area was cheerful, food was adequate and maybe a step above most continential breakfast stations. They offer a complimentary shuttle service around the area, including the cruise ship terminal at Canada Place. (Definitely a perc.) Reservations for the shuttle service is first come, first serve. We called promptly at 7:00 am and had no problem getting the shuttle for the time we wanted. If you want a more centrally located hotel you might be disappointed. On the other hand, with all the major pre-Olympics construction going on next to the more pricey hotels the Hampton may be your quieter choice unless you're booking it on a night an event is going on at the arena across the street.

Reviews.Title: “It's ok”
Reviews.Author: Wood71
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 10 days and although the hotel is fine I think a lot of the reviews on here are over the top. Breakfast is ok but nothing amazing! Rooms are tidy but bland Lacks a decent hotel bar Very near the dodgy end of town Good service from front desk

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel at a great price”
Reviews.Author: Ninajay
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for nearly three weeks, in a standard room for 2 weeks and a king suite for one week. The rooms were thoroughly cleaned every day, staff were cheerful and extermely helpful. We were getting married during our stay the staff couldn't have been more lovely. Friends and family were staying at the Wall Sheraton and Sutton Place and our standard room had more room and was brighter than either of theirs. The sky train station and bus stop were close by if the 10 minute walk up to Burrad/Roson was too far. The babystitting service recommended to us by the staff were brilliant. All in all we would definitely go back to this hotel on our next trip to Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “I love the Hampton Inn”
Reviews.Author: LuvSLO
Reviews.Content: I will forever be a fan of the Hampton Inn and Suites after staying at the Vancouver location. After 6 days in Whistler, we concluded our honeymoon with a short stay in Vancouver (awesome city by the way). The Hampton Inn exceeded my expectations 100 fold. We stayed in a King Bed 1 Bedroom Suite. We found an inexpensive fare on Travelocity and paid CAD 130 per night....a PHENOMENAL deal for a hotel of these standards. First, the room was clean, cozy and had a kitchenette, which I wasn't expecting (I thought it would have a microwave and that's all). It even had a scale and free internet if you brought a computer. Second, the front desk staff was absolutley awesome...very helpful and eager to help with anything. There was even a free shuttle that drove us around town and saved us a bundle on taxi fares. The shuttle took us to and from the Aquarium (which was very cool) and to Chinatown and the ferry boats to get to Granville Island. The complimentary breakfast is 100% phenomenal. It had everything you could want (within reason of course), was very clean and tidy. I think the location was pretty convenient as well. I wish we had more time in the beautiful city of Vancouver and in the comforts of the Hampton Inn because we loved every minute of our stay. Enjoy...definitely stay here if you are going to Vancouver....best value in the city by far!!!!

Reviews.Title: “It's great - honest”
Reviews.Author: heather_nun_ya
Reviews.Content: I have to admit - I almost changed our reservations to a trendier hotel in Yaletown that was almost twice the price. I just didn't believe that so many positive reviews could be real. But I was wrong. We went to Vancouver to do the tourist stuff and to go to a Canucks hockey game. The Hampton was appealing because of it's location - downtown next to GM Place and near museums and shopping. I was a bit disappointed when we checked in and during the few days we were there, the roof top hot tub was closed for yearly maintenance (just our luck). However, I had booked a "deluxe" room which had a jacuzzi big enough for two people! Plus, two whole walls of our corner room were windows so we had a great view of the city. The breakfast had cold items as well as sausage and eggs. Everything was good quality and fresh. The staff was really wonderful as well. They were all helpful (giving directions and coupons and advice) and very cheerful and polite. This is a very nice place to stay and it's a great, great value.

Reviews.Title: “TripAdvisor does it again!”
Reviews.Author: BoeingDad
Reviews.Content: We stayed here to visit the Chinese New Year celebrations with two adults and four kids - three of them teens. All of the reviews were right on. Great breakfast, great room (#1203), first run movies on two TVs in seperate french door divided rooms. Full kitchen and cooking supplies (no oven). Excellent, helpful staff. The $12 secure parking was double gated in the garage. There was no noise in our 12th floor suite from the city. I asked about Dim Sum and they printed directions up for two different places in Chinatown. The top floor of the hotel is a great workout, TV and small pool sized hot tub for about 15 people. Everything looks out to a nice view. I could go on and on, but read the reviews like I did. There's no argument from me on any of them. I've been writing here in TripAdvisor for a long time, and I can tell you as fact that this is the only place to stay in Vancouver, BC.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and real value for money”
Reviews.Author: Looseal
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel last week at the recommendation of trip advisor reviews and we were not disapointed, it was great. We were upgraded to a suite and it was very well appointed, clean and luxurious. I was very surprised that it was this cheap. The breakfast was acceptable although the plastic plates and cutlery were a little bit of a let down. However all in all this hotel is in a good location, parking is easy and the hotel staff will do everything they can to help you. I would recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: ctmb-traveller
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hampton 12/26 - 12/30/05 after reading reviews in TripAdvisor. Our family of four stayed in a suite on the 15th floor (room 1503, $143 Cdn/night +tax) and found the room large and comfortable, the staff very friendly and helpful, and the breakfast predictible but good. The location was fine to get easily to the shops on Robson etc. My 9-year old son would have loved to have a pool but he still had fun in the hot tub and with the table tennis table. I would definitely return to the same hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Exemplary 5-Star Hotel at a 3-Star Price!”
Reviews.Author: SA&WJ
Reviews.Content: We stayed in 2 king suites overlooking the city from the 12th and 14th floors for the same price per room as standard rooms in Seattle (excellent bargain!)....spectacular views, first-rate accommodations (the rooms were like executive suites at a 5-star hotel...spacious, clean, new beds and bedding, beautifully appointed), friendly staff....the hostess at breakfast was exceptional (welcoming, attentive and thoughtful). The breakfast was also a nice surprise...fresh fruit salad, juices, eggs, sausage, cereal, milk, a variety of muffins and breads, bagels/cream cheese, etc. The management has definitely taken this hotel to a new level of superior accommodations and service!!!! The jacuzzi, exercise room and sun deck on the top of the hotel have spectacular city views too. Great location....right across the street from GM Place (where the Vancouver Canucks play), short walk to downtown mega-mall shopping and restaurants, and a casino is also nearby. This is our favorite hotel worldwide!! (We will be trying to find reasons to back to Vancouver just to stay here.)

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good for a larger, mid range hotel.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Pretty much what you would expect of a mid-range, fairly large hotel; clean, furnishings in good condition, pretty convenient location, large selection of television chanels, laundry. What this hotel does offer that some others do not is a refrigerator in the room, two complementary bottles of water a day, free gym and spa facility and a substantial buffet breakfast each day. They also have a complementary hotel bus, which we used to get from the hotel to Stanley Park and from the hotel to the Bus Station.

Reviews.Title: “Great breakfasts”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for three nights at the beginning of our trip and one night at the end. We had expected an average quality hotel but were pleasantly surprised with every detail. Reception staff were knowledgeable and friendly. Our room was spacious, comfortable and very clean. The balcony by the fitness area at the top of the building offered excellent views over the city. Best of all was the breakfast - excellent choice, with sausage and eggs, fruit, yoghurt and toast. Being able to linger over the coffee and newspaper in the morning really set us up for the day.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Thank you... A great place to stay. We really enjoyed our stay at this Hotel. Its a little way out of the city but in walking distance. Get view from the entertainment room. Would stay here again. Next time we travel we will stay in more Hampton Inns..

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel...new and clean”
Reviews.Author: VegasCanuck
Reviews.Content: Very nice new hotel in a pretty good location. I was upgraded to a suite after a reservation mishap at the front desk. New "Totally Fresh Bed". What a treat. Restaurant in the lobby was decent. Amazing West Coast Chowder...yum! See attached photos of the room and view from the 12th floor.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel last June. The hotel was very clean, and staff were very helpful. They helped organise a whale watching trip for us to Victoria, which was great. It has secure parking, where we left the car for the duration of our stay. Had no problem getting taxis round the city. The breakfast was great, and free tea and coffee are available all day. Good location, as we could easily walk to restaurants and shops.

Reviews.Title: “We Highly Recommend!”
Reviews.Author: GenerationXer
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just came back from our 4 day/night stay at the Hampton and we would definitely stay there again! We had spent days looking for a hotel online that was reasonably priced, located in a good area, and had good amenities. Here's what we got: 1. Price: We paid only $119 a night for a room with a jacuzzi, a king size bed, ceiling to floor windows with an amazing view of the city, complimentary breakfast - (scrambled eggs, cinnamon buns, muffins, toast, english muffins, coffee, tea, cereal, fresh fruit, yogurt, danishes, juice, etc.) The room even had a complimentary umbrella for us to use - and we definitely used it. A nice touch! 2. Location: Contrary to what some of the reviews said, the location was great! We were within walking distance to the sky train, great shops, etc. It was on the quieter end of Robson but not that far away...(however, we do love to walk.) It felt safe in our area - there were many panhandlers and homeless people downtown but we did not see any within a few blocks of our hotel. They were mostly on the busier area of Robson and definitely on Granville! 3. Amenities: On the 16th floor was the excercise room, hot tub, ping pong table, foosball table, sauna, balcony with a great view, couches, etc. It was opened until midnight every night. We even entertained some friends there for an hour or two while we were waiting to go out for the evening! Too bad there wasn't a pool! 4. Service: Excellent service right from calling them over the phone to book our stay...to our last day there. Every employee we met were smiling and friendly! My husband and I ran into a small problem on our last day; we ended up shopping a little too much and did not have any room in our luggage to carry the extra goodies. The front desk staff helped out and found us a box that fit perfectly and gave us packing tape to seal it! Plus, we got these chocolates that were crazy good on our last night! (They ended up giving us an extra box of chocolates at the front desk - just because!) There were only 2 problems that we had during our stay at the Hampton and they were minor problems: 1. the tv was kind of wonky - colour was changing from being too red to kinda green, and was also a little fuzzy at times while watching shows and movies. 2. the shower leaked and we had to use all our towels to sop up the water on the floor! (only on the first night though) Having said ALL of that, you really won't regret your stay at the Hampton! Hope this helps with your decision.

Reviews.Title: “Big comfort, reasonable price tag”
Reviews.Author: Mozart_fan
Reviews.Content: Wow, we were pleasantly surprised at this hotel. The Web site photos do not do it justice. The hotel is clean, modern and far enough from the sleazy part of Granville Street yet near enough to walk to the shopping heart of Robson. Chinatown is less than 5 blocks away. The reception staff is accomodating and courteous. The breakfast is substantial and tasty (compared to other chain hotels with 'free breakfasts') that included eggs and sausage, yoghurt, fruit, all kind of breads, juice and milk -- do tip those hardworking breakfast staff who scurry around to replenish the stock and keep the counters/tables clean guest after guest. The guest rooms are light and bright; the beds and duvet are super clean and comfortable. The bathroom is well-stocked and the bathtub/shower was even equipped with pump shower gel and shampoo. Exercise room could be a little better maintained but the view of the city from that floor makes up for it. Would definitely return on next visit to Vancouver. Way to go!

Reviews.Title: “Wow!”
Reviews.Author: BirdingIsFun
Reviews.Content: I can't say enough about how pleased we were with this hotel. My very quiet 12th floor corner room had floor-to-ceiling windows overlooking the city, the North Vancouver hills, the sunrise, and even a bit of the bay. The new "fresh beds" are cozy and comfortable, and the room had little helpful touches you might not find even in a more expensive hotel: a lap desk, umbrella, safe and free in-room coffee and bottled water. A full breakfast buffet is included, with hot scrambled eggs and sausage as well as cereals, juice, breads, and yogurt. And all of this for a remarkably low price (less than $100 U.S.). The underground parking lot has ridiculously tight spaces and is overpriced at $12/night - that would be pretty much my only complaint. It's true the hotel isn't in the busy tourist section down by the waterfront, but it was very convenient for our needs. I would definitely stay here again and recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Best Value”
Reviews.Author: dfword
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel and a great value. If you don't mind walking five short city blocks to the main shopping area, you can't beat it. The rooms room and are impeccable, with free in-room high speed Internet access and great cable channels. An added bonus is a mini kitchen with a microwave, sink, and fridge. The exercise room is more than adequate, and the free breakfasts are much better than the standard toast and cereal fare dished out at other chains. Some posts mention "unsavory" characters hanging around, or that it's not in the best area of the city. Give me a break! The neighborhood is clean and very safe--have these folks been in a major US city lately? Vancouver is the cleanest and friendliest large city I have ever visited. The staff is extremely helpful. The only complaint I had is that there is not a separate elevator for the cleaning staff to use, and during busy times this can make the wait for an elevator a bit long. But minor quibbles aside, this is a great place.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Moofe
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights in late August 2005. The hotel is modern, bright and clean. Had a fantastic corner room on the 14th floor overlooking BC Place. The complimentary breakfast was excellent and included toast, cereals, eggs, fruit and bagels etc. It's worth a trip to the 16th floor for the amazing views of Vancouver at night. Must mention that the reception staff were extremely friendly and helpful. We asked for restaurant recommendations and they were great every time, especially Moxies. Would happily stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for the money”
Reviews.Author: C_GLondon_UK
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for three nights prior to embarking on an Alaskan cruise from Vancouver. The hotel was excellent. Very quiet; it was extremely easy to get a good night's sleep. The service was brilliant. After a long flight and having been awake for nearly 24 hrs when we arrived at the hotel, the receptionist was very accomadating and allowed us to check in at 11.00am. The continental breakfast that was included in the price was v good. The only reservation we had was with the location. It wasn't terrible, and was within easy reach of most of the tourist spots of Vancouver (Gastown, Yaletown, China Town, Robson St shopping etc), but it was located on the quieter end of Robson St, and this is also the more downtrodden end of the main shopping street. But don't let this put you off. It was value for money and we would stay there again. Plus, they did a free shuttle service to any part of downtown Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service”
Reviews.Author: b2buck
Reviews.Content: Everything about this hotel was top notch. Our room was clean and well laid out. The front desk and bell personnel were very friendly and helpful. We got there before our room was ready and the held our luggage and gave us directions to a great lunch at Yaletown Brewing. Well worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “Good, comfortable hotel”
Reviews.Author: jimmcc09
Reviews.Content: One bedroom suite very comfortable. Upper floor had little traffic noise. Location quite good – easy walk to Canada Place, and Yaletown with all its restaurants very close. Hotel service good – everyone willing and helpful. Breakfast a bit of a melee at times, but good quality – and free. Recommendations from hotel staff on local restaurants never included the in-house restaurant. Gave lots of other good recommendations though. Best was Moxies, (less than three minutes walk at diagonal opposite corner of the same block), which had great food, service and was good value.

Reviews.Title: “2 words : over rated”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: noisy room. bad view. stale air. service was ok at best. the cleaning lady kindly reminded me at 10:50 am when i was walking out the door that i needed to check out at 11am.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place to stay”
Reviews.Author: MKGRedmond
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in Vancouver many times and this hotel undoubtedly has the most helpful, knowledgeable and accomodating staff that we have ever encountered. They rank up there with a concierge at the best of hotels. Plus the free downtown shuttle service and the great location, not more than a 15 minute walk from most Vancouver attractions, makes this a very convenient place to stay. We stayed in a very quiet and roomy suite which was well laid out and particularly pleasant for families traveling with kids, as there were two televisions and the living room was separated from the bedroom by french doors. The only drawbacks for us were that there is no pool (indoor or outdoor) and that there are not sufficient elevators to serve the entire building; only two elevators for a 16 story building. But its location at the end of Robson Street makes it a very quiet place to stay and a little oasis in the midst of an incredibly vibrant, bustling and busy downtown. Breakfast is pretty good but a bit boring and the menu did not change for the five days we were there. We would easily stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Hospitality Awaits You!”
Reviews.Author: Lauren00616
Reviews.Content: My family and I just returned from a 5 night stay at this fine hotel. We found the front desk personnel to be very accomodating throughout our stay. In fact, at one point, one of them overheard us talking about forgetting a toothbrush and they immediately came to our rescue with a toothbrush in hand! Our room was very clean and the Maid service kept it that way. The complimentary breakfast buffet has a wide variety of bread, bagels, english muffins, cinnamon rolls, cereals, fruit, yogurt, eggs and sausage. The quality is good. Here's a tip: If you don't get to the buffet before the crowd, and you find yourself with no where to sit, just ask the hostess for a tray and take your food to your room. We did, and it worked great. The Hampton Inn is conveniently located in the downtown area, near a variety of shops and restaurants. We found the BEST place to enjoy a great meal and superb service is downstairs at Zachary's. This also happens to be where room service is ordered. I highly recommend the Salmon & Halibut Linguini, it was soooooooo good! The 16th floor has a ping pong table, foosball, gym equipment, treadmills, bike, TV's, jacuzzi, sauna, locker room and showers. We enjoyed all these great amenities (daily) during our stay. Here are a few places that make it to the Must See, Must Do category: BC Feeries Cruise to Vancouver Island- Victoria and Buschard Gardens Stanley Park- Vancouver Aquarium, hike, bike or walk the park's many trails or beaches The Museum of Anthropology, overlooks the ocean and mountains with impressive selection of Aboriginal art and exhibits Kayaking off of Vancouver Island's west coast The only downside to our stay here was that there are a few unsavory individuals that roam the streets and parking lot directly across from the hotel. Keep in mind though, that this is an unfortunate fact in many areas. The atttached photo captures the magnificent view from the spa area on the 16th floor- enjoy!!

HotelInfo.Name: Hampton Inn & Suites Downtown Vancouver
HotelInfo.Address: 111 Robson St, Vancouver, British Columbia V6B 2A8, Canada
